metadata.text_en: Whoever, not being a public servant, but intending to defraud, wears any garb or carries any token resembling any garb or token used by a public servant as such, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: “Candidate”, “electoral right” defined
metadata.text_en: The words “candidate” and “electoral right” are defined in the following clauses: (a) “Candidate” means a person who has been nominated as a candidate at any election, and includes a person who has declared himself to be a candidate for any election, or who has otherwise come forward as a candidate at any election if the context so admits; (b) “Electoral right” means the right of a person to stand, or not to stand as, or to withdraw from being, a candidate, or to vote or abstain from voting at an election.

metadata.title_en: Bribery
metadata.text_en: (1) Whoever — (i) gives a gratification to any person with the object of inducing him or any other person to exercise any electoral right or of rewarding any person for having exercised any electoral right; or (ii) accepts a gratification as a motive or reward for exercising any electoral right or for inducing any other person to exercise any electoral right, is said to commit the offence of bribery: Provided that a declaration of public policy or a promise of public action shall not be deemed to be bribery. (2) A person who offers, or agrees to give, or offers or attempts to procure a gratification shall be deemed to give a gratification. (3) A person who accepts, or agrees to accept, or attempts to obtain a gratification shall be deemed to accept a gratification. (4) A person who obtains a gratification for another person, or induces a person to accept a gratification shall be deemed to accept a gratification.

metadata.title_en: Undue influence at elections
metadata.text_en: Whoever directly or indirectly interferes or attempts to interfere with the free exercise of any electoral right commits the offence of undue influence at an election.

metadata.title_en: Personation at elections
metadata.text_en: Whoever at an election applies for a voting paper or votes in the name of any other person, whether living or dead, or in a fictitious name, or who, having voted once at such election, applies at the same election for another voting paper in his own name, and does any act thereby to secure such voting paper, or votes again, commits the offence of personation at an election.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for bribery
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits the offence of bribery shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to two thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for undue influence or personation at an election
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits the offence of undue influence or personation at an election shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to two thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: False statement in connection with an election
metadata.text_en: Whoever, with intent to affect the result of an election, makes or publishes any statement purporting to be a statement of fact, which is false, and which he either knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true, in relation to the personal character or conduct of any candidate or in relation to the withdrawal from candidature of any candidate, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Illegal payments in connection with an election
metadata.text_en: Whoever incurs or authorizes expenditure in excess of the amount allowed by any law in force relating to election expenses, or in contravention of any requirement of such law, shall be punished with fine which may extend to two thousand kyats: Provided that this section shall not apply to any expenditure incurred or authorized by a candidate or his agent for the purpose only of providing food or drink, not being intoxicating liquor, to any elector at a bonafide public meeting or to any expenditure incurred or authorized by any person for the purpose of printing, publishing or issuing any election circular or advertisement containing a statement of his own views and not referring to the personal character or conduct of any other candidate, if the name and address of the printer and publisher thereof are shown thereon.

metadata.title_en: Failure to keep election accounts
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being required by any law in force or by any rule having the force of law to keep accounts of election expenses, fails to keep such accounts, or to submit them, as required by such law or rule, shall be punished with fine which may extend to two thousand kyats.

metadata.title_en: Illegal hiring or procuring of conveyances at elections
metadata.text_en: Whoever, for the purpose of promoting the election of a candidate, hires or procures, or engages, or promises to hire or procure, or engage, any conveyance, or uses any such conveyance for the free conveyance of any elector other than himself to or from any polling station, or to or from any place appointed for the exhibition of the names or symbols of the candidates, or for any public meeting or other purpose relating to the election of a candidate: Provided that nothing in this section shall apply to any public conveyance, or to any conveyance hired or procured by an elector at his own cost for the purpose of conveying himself to or from any such polling station or place.

metadata.title_en: Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding
metadata.text_en: Whoever absconds in order to avoid being served with a summons, notice or order proceeding from any public servant legally competent, as such public servant, to issue such summons, notice or order, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Preventing service of summons or other proceeding, or preventing publication thereof
metadata.text_en: Whoever in any manner intentionally prevents the serving on himself, or on any other person, of any summons, notice or order proceeding from any public servant legally competent, as such public servant, to issue such summons, notice or order, or intentionally prevents the lawful affixing to any place of any such summons, notice or order, or intentionally removes any such summons, notice or order from any place to which it has been lawfully affixed, or intentionally prevents the lawful publication of any such summons, notice or order, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Non-attendance in obedience to an order from public servant
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being legally bound to attend in person or by an agent at a certain place and time in obedience to a summons, notice or order, proceeding from any public servant legally competent, as such public servant, to issue the same, intentionally omits to attend at that place or time, or departs from the place where he is bound to attend before the time at which it is lawful for him to depart, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Omission to produce document to public servant by person legally bound to produce it
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being legally bound to produce or deliver any document to any public servant, intentionally omits to produce or deliver that document, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being legally bound to give any notice or to furnish any information on any subject to any public servant, intentionally omits to give such notice or to furnish such information, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Furnishing false information
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being legally bound to furnish information on any subject to any public servant, as such public servant, furnishes, as true, information which he knows or has reason to believe to be false, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Refusing oath or affirmation when duly required by public servant to make it
metadata.text_en: Whoever refuses to bind himself by an oath or affirmation to state the truth, when required so to bind himself by a public servant legally competent to require that he shall so bind himself, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Refusing to answer public servant authorized to question
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being legally bound to state the truth on any subject to any public servant, refuses to answer any question demanded of him touching that subject by such public servant in the exercise of the legal powers of such public servant, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Refusing to sign statement
metadata.text_en: Whoever refuses to sign any statement made by him, when required to sign that statement by a public servant legally competent to require that he shall sign it, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: False statement on oath or affirmation to public servant or person authorized to administer an oath or affirmation
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being legally bound by an oath or affirmation to state the truth on any subject to any public servant or other person authorized by law to administer an oath or affirmation, makes, to such public servant or other person as aforesaid, touching that subject, any statement which is false, and which he either knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: False information, with intent to cause public servant to use his lawful power to the injury of another person
metadata.text_en: Whoever gives to any public servant any information which he knows or believes to be false, intending thereby to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, such public servant— (a) to do or omit anything which such public servant ought not to do or omit if the true state of facts respecting which such information is given were known by him; or (b) to use the lawful power of such public servant to the injury or annoyance of any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Resistance to the taking of property by the lawful authority of a public servant
metadata.text_en: Whoever offers any resistance to the taking of any property by the lawful authority of any public servant, knowing or having reason to believe that he is such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Obstructing sale of property offered for sale by the authority of a public servant
metadata.text_en: Whoever intentionally obstructs the sale of any property offered for sale by the lawful authority of any public servant, knowing or having reason to believe that he is such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Illegal purchase or bid for property offered for sale by the authority of a public servant
metadata.text_en: Whoever, at any sale of property held by the lawful authority of any public servant, as such public servant, purchases or bids for any property, or offers to purchase or bid for any property, either in his own name or in the name of another, or jointly with others, or in shares, being legally prohibited from so doing, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both; and if he buys, the property shall be confiscated.

metadata.title_en: Obstructing public servant in discharge of his public functions
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily obstructs any public servant in the discharge of his public functions, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Omission to assist public servant when bound by law to give assistance
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being bound by law to render or furnish assistance to any public servant in the execution of his public duty, intentionally omits to give such assistance, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to two hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Disobedience to an order duly promulgated by public servant
metadata.text_en: Whoever, knowing that he is directed by a public servant lawfully empowered in that behalf to abstain from a certain act, or to take certain order with certain property in his possession or under his management, disobeys such direction, and if such disobedience causes or tends to cause obstruction, annoyance or injury, or risk of obstruction, annoyance or injury, to any person lawfully employed, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to two hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Threat of injury to public servant
metadata.text_en: Whoever holds out any threat of injury to any public servant, or to any person in whom he is interested, for the purpose of inducing that public servant to do any act or forbear to do any act, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Threat of injury to induce person to refrain from applying for protection to public servant
metadata.text_en: Whoever holds out any threat of injury to any person for the purpose of inducing that person to refrain from applying for protection against injury to any public servant legally empowered to give such protection, or to cause such public servant to withdraw such protection, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Giving false evidence
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being legally bound by an oath or by any express provision of law to state the truth, or being bound by law to make a declaration upon any subject, makes any statement which is false, and which he either knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true, is said to give false evidence.

metadata.title_en: Fabricating false evidence
metadata.text_en: Whoever causes any circumstance to exist, or makes any false entry in any book or record, or makes any document containing a false statement, intending that such circumstance, false entry or false statement may appear in evidence in a judicial proceeding, or in any proceeding taken by law before a public servant as such, or before an arbitrator, and that such circumstance, false entry or false statement, so appearing in evidence, may cause any person who in such proceeding is to form an opinion upon the evidence, to entertain an erroneous opinion touching any material point, is said to fabricate false evidence.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for false evidence
metadata.text_en: Whoever intentionally gives false evidence or fabricates false evidence in any stage of a judicial proceeding, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine; and whoever intentionally gives or fabricates false evidence in any other case, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of capital offence
metadata.text_en: Whoever gives or fabricates false evidence, intending thereby to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, any person to be convicted of an offence which is punishable with death, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of offence punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for seven years or upwards
metadata.text_en: Whoever gives or fabricates false evidence, intending thereby to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, any person to be convicted of an offence which is punishable with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for a term of seven years or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Using evidence known to be false
metadata.text_en: Whoever corruptly uses or attempts to use as true or genuine evidence any evidence which he knows to be false or fabricated, shall be punished in the same manner as if he gave or fabricated false evidence.

metadata.title_en: Issuing or signing false certificate
metadata.text_en: Whoever issues or signs any certificate required by law to be given or signed, or relating to any fact of which such certificate is by law admissible in evidence, knowing or believing that such certificate is false in any material point, shall be punished in the same manner as if he gave false evidence.

metadata.title_en: Using as true a certificate known to be false
metadata.text_en: Whoever corruptly uses or attempts to use any such certificate as a true certificate, knowing that the same is false in any material point, shall be punished in the same manner as if he gave false evidence.

metadata.title_en: False statement made in declaration which is by law receivable as evidence
metadata.text_en: Whoever, in any declaration made or subscribed by him, which declaration any Court of Justice, or any public servant or other person, is bound or authorized by law to receive as evidence of any fact, makes any statement which is false, and which he either knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true, touching any point material to the object for which the declaration is made or used, shall be punished in the same manner as if he gave false evidence.

metadata.title_en: Using as true any such declaration knowing it to be false
metadata.text_en: Whoever corruptly uses or attempts to use as true any such declaration, knowing that the same is false in any material point, shall be punished in the same manner as if he gave false evidence.

metadata.title_en: Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offender
metadata.text_en: Whoever, knowing or having reason to believe that an offence has been committed, causes any evidence of the commission of that offence to disappear, with the intention of screening the offender from legal punishment, or with that intention gives any information respecting the offence which he knows or believes to be false, shall— (a) if the offence which he knows or believes to have been committed is punishable with death, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine; (b) if the offence is punishable with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment for seven years or upwards, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine; (c) if the offence is punishable with imprisonment for less than seven years, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one-fourth part of the longest term of the imprisonment provided for the offence, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Intentional omission to give information of offence by person legally bound to inform
metadata.text_en: Whoever, knowing or having reason to believe that an offence has been committed, intentionally omits to give any information respecting that offence which he is legally bound to give, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Giving false information respecting an offence committed
metadata.text_en: Whoever gives any information which he knows or believes to be false, respecting the commission of an offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Destruction of document to prevent its production as evidence
metadata.text_en: Whoever secretes or destroys any document or electronic record which he may be lawfully compelled to produce as evidence in a Court of Justice, or in any proceeding lawfully held before a public servant, as such, or intentionally prevents anyone from producing, or intentionally causes to be prevented from producing, any document or electronic record which he may be lawfully compelled to produce as evidence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: False personation for purpose of act or proceeding in suit or prosecution
metadata.text_en: Whoever falsely personates another, and in such assumed character makes any admission or statement, or confesses judgment, or causes any process to be issued or executed, or does any other act in the course of a suit or criminal prosecution, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently removes, conceals, or delivers to any person, or transfers or causes to be transferred to any person, any property or any interest therein, intending thereby to prevent that property or interest therein from being taken as a forfeiture or in satisfaction of a fine, under a sentence or order which has been pronounced, or which he knows to be likely to be pronounced, by a Court of Justice or other competent authority, or from being taken in execution of a decree or order which has been made, or which he knows to be likely to be made, by a Court of Justice or any other competent authority, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Fraudulent claim to property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently accepts, receives or claims any property or any interest therein, knowing that he has no right to such property or interest, or that the property or interest is liable to be taken as a forfeiture or in satisfaction of a fine, under a sentence or order which has been pronounced, or which he knows to be likely to be pronounced, by a Court of Justice or other competent authority, or is liable to be taken in execution of a decree or order which has been made, or which he knows to be likely to be made, by a Court of Justice or any other competent authority, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Fraudulently suffering decree for sum not due
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently causes or suffers a decree or order to be passed against him for a sum not due, or for a larger sum than is due, or for any property or interest in property to which he is not entitled, or fraudulently causes or suffers a decree or order to be executed against him in respect of a sum not due, or for a larger sum than is due, or for any property or interest in property to which he is not entitled, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: False charge of offence made with intent to injure
metadata.text_en: Whoever, with intent to injure any person, makes to any of the authorities hereinafter in this section mentioned, a false charge of an offence knowing or having reason to believe that such charge is false, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Fraudulently obtaining decree for sum not due
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently obtains a decree or order against any person for a sum not due, or for a larger sum than is due, or for any property or interest in property to which he is not entitled, or fraudulently causes a decree or order to be executed against any person in respect of a sum not due, or for a larger sum than is due, or for any property or interest in property to which he is not entitled, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: False charge of offence with intent to injure
metadata.text_en: Whoever, with intent to cause injury to any person, institutes or causes to be instituted any criminal proceeding against that person, or falsely charges any person with having committed an offence, knowing that there is no just or lawful ground for such proceeding or charge against that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Harbouring offender
metadata.text_en: Whenever an offence has been committed, whoever harbours or conceals a person whom he knows or has reason to believe to be the offender, with the intention of screening him from legal punishment, shall— (a) if the offence is punishable with death, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine; (b) if the offence is punishable with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment for seven years or upwards, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine; (c) if the offence is punishable with imprisonment for less than seven years, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one-fourth part of the longest term of the imprisonment provided for the offence, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Offering gift or restoration of property in consideration of screening offender
metadata.text_en: Whoever accepts or attempts to obtain, or agrees to accept, any gratification, or any restoration or compensation of property, in consideration of his concealing an offence or of his screening any person from legal punishment for any offence, or of his not proceeding against any person for any offence, or of his abandoning any proceeding already instituted for any offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Harbouring thief or dacoit
metadata.text_en: Whoever, knowing or having reason to believe that any person has committed or has been concerned in any theft or dacoity, harbours or conceals that person with the intention of screening him from legal punishment, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Taking gift to help to recover stolen property, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever takes or agrees or consents to take any gratification, under pretence or on account of assisting in the recovery of any stolen property, knowing or having reason to believe that the same is stolen property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Harbouring offender who has escaped from custody, or whose apprehension has been ordered
metadata.text_en: Whoever, knowing or having reason to believe that a person has committed an offence punishable with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment for a term of seven years or upwards, harbours or conceals that person, with the intention of screening him from legal punishment, or from apprehension, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Harbouring robbers or dacoits
metadata.text_en: Whoever, knowing or having reason to believe that any person is a robber or dacoit, harbours or conceals that person, with the intention of screening him from legal punishment, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Public servant disobeying direction of law with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a public servant, knowingly disobeys any direction of the law as to the manner in which he is to conduct himself as such public servant, intending thereby to save, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby save, any person from punishment or any property from forfeiture or any charge to which it is liable, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Public servant framing incorrect record or writing with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a public servant, and being charged with the preparation or translation of any document or electronic record, or the formation or translation of any entry in any book or record, or with the keeping of any document or electronic record as such public servant, intentionally frames or translates that document or electronic record or entry in a manner which he knows or believes to be incorrect, intending thereby to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, injury to any person, or to save any person from punishment or to save any property from forfeiture or any charge to which it is liable, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Public servant in judicial proceeding corruptly making report, etc., contrary to law
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a public servant, and being bound by law to make an inquiry or investigation into an offence, or to report upon any subject in a judicial proceeding, or to make or translate any document or electronic record, or to record evidence, intentionally makes or translates, or records or delivers, a report, document, electronic record or evidence which he knows or believes to be incorrect, or has reason to believe to be incorrect, intending thereby to cause injury to any person, or to save any person from punishment or to save any property from forfeiture or any charge to which it is liable, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Commitment for trial or confinement by person having authority who knows that he is acting contrary to law
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being in any office in the Police or Customs Department, or in any other office of a like nature, and knowing that he is acting contrary to law, or having reason to believe that he is acting contrary to law, commits any person for trial or confinement, or keeps any person in confinement, without legal warrant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of public servant bound to apprehend
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a public servant, legally bound as such public servant to apprehend or to keep in confinement any person charged with or liable to be apprehended for an offence, intentionally omits to apprehend such person, or suffers such person to escape, or intentionally aids such person in escaping, or intentionally omits to keep such person in confinement, or suffers such person to escape from confinement, or intentionally aids such person in escaping from confinement, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of public servant bound to apprehend
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a public servant, legally bound as such public servant to apprehend or to keep in confinement any person charged with or convicted of an offence, or liable to be apprehended for an offence, intentionally omits to apprehend such person, or suffers such person to escape, or intentionally aids such person in escaping, or intentionally omits to keep such person in confinement, or suffers such person to escape from confinement, or intentionally aids such person in escaping from confinement, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Escape from confinement or custody negligently suffered by public servant
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a public servant, and having the lawful custody of any person for an offence, negligently suffers such person to escape from confinement or custody, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Resistance or obstruction by a person to his lawful apprehension
metadata.text_en: Whoever intentionally offers any resistance or illegal obstruction to the lawful apprehension of himself for any offence with which he is charged or of which he has been convicted, or for whose apprehension an order has been issued, or who escapes or attempts to escape from any custody in which he is lawfully detained for any such offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension of another person
metadata.text_en: Whoever intentionally offers any resistance or illegal obstruction to the lawful apprehension of any other person for an offence, or rescues or attempts to rescue any other person from any custody in which that person is lawfully detained for an offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Omission to apprehend, or suffer escape, on part of public servant in cases not otherwise provided for
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a public servant, legally bound as such public servant to apprehend or to keep in confinement any person charged with or liable to be apprehended for an offence, intentionally omits to apprehend such person, or suffers such person to escape, or intentionally aids such person in escaping, or intentionally omits to keep such person in confinement, or suffers such person to escape from confinement, or intentionally aids such person in escaping from confinement, in any case not otherwise provided for in this Code, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Unlawful return of transportation
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a public servant, and being legally bound to give transportation, without lawful excuse, unlawfully returns such transportation, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Violation of condition of remission of punishment
metadata.text_en: Whoever, having accepted any conditional remission of punishment, knowingly violates any condition on which such remission was granted, shall be punished with the punishment to which he was originally sentenced, if such punishment has not been inflicted; or, if part of such punishment has been inflicted, with so much of the punishment as has not been inflicted.

metadata.title_en: Intentional insult or interruption to public servant sitting in judicial proceeding
metadata.text_en: Whoever intentionally offers any insult or causes any interruption to any public servant while such public servant is sitting in any stage of a judicial proceeding, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Personation of a juror or assessor
metadata.text_en: Whoever, by personation or otherwise, intentionally causes, or knowingly suffers himself to be returned, empanelled or sworn as a juror or assessor in any case in which he knows that he is not entitled by law to be a juror or assessor, or in which he knows that he is disqualified from serving as a juror or assessor, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Disclosure of identity of victim of certain offences
metadata.text_en: (1) Whoever prints or publishes the name or any matter which may make known the identity of any person against whom an offence under sections 376, 376A, 376B, 376C, 376D, 376DA, 376DB, 376E or section 509 is alleged or found to have been committed (hereinafter in this section referred to as the victim), shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine which may extend to five hundred thousand kyats, or with both. (2) Nothing in sub-section (1) extends to any printing or publication by or under the order of any Court. (3) The printing or publication of the name or any matter which may make known the identity of the victim may be made if such printing or publication is for the purpose of investigation, in accordance with law.

metadata.title_en: “Coin” defined
metadata.text_en: “Coin” is metal used as money, stamped and issued by the authority of some Government in order to be so used.

metadata.title_en: Counterfeiting coin
metadata.text_en: Whoever counterfeits or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Counterfeiting Myanmar coin
metadata.text_en: Whoever counterfeits or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting Myanmar coin, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting coin
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes or mends, or performs any part of the process of making or mending, or buys, sells or disposes of, any die or instrument for the purpose of being used, or knowing or having reason to believe that the same is intended to be used, for the purpose of counterfeiting coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Myanmar coin
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes or mends, or performs any part of the process of making or mending, or buys, sells or disposes of, any die or instrument for the purpose of being used, or knowing or having reason to believe that the same is intended to be used, for the purpose of counterfeiting Myanmar coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting coin
metadata.text_en: Whoever is in possession of any instrument or material for the purpose of using the same for counterfeiting coin, or knowing or having reason to believe that the same is intended to be used for that purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting Myanmar coin
metadata.text_en: Whoever is in possession of any instrument or material for the purpose of using the same for counterfeiting Myanmar coin, or knowing or having reason to believe that the same is intended to be used for that purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Import or export of counterfeit coin
metadata.text_en: Whoever imports into or exports from Myanmar any counterfeit coin, knowing the same to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Import or export of counterfeit Myanmar coin
metadata.text_en: Whoever imports into or exports from Myanmar any counterfeit Myanmar coin, knowing the same to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Delivery of coin possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
metadata.text_en: Whoever, having any counterfeit coin, which at the time of becoming possessed of it he knew to be counterfeit, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers the same to any person, or attempts to induce any person to receive it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Delivery of Myanmar coin possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
metadata.text_en: Whoever, having any counterfeit Myanmar coin, which at the time of becoming possessed of it he knew to be counterfeit, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers the same to any person, or attempts to induce any person to receive it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Delivery of coin as genuine, which, when first possessed, the deliverer did not know to be counterfeit
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers to any person as genuine, or attempts to induce any person to receive as genuine, any coin which he knows to be counterfeit, but which he did not know to be counterfeit at the time when he first came into possession of it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine which may extend to ten times the value of the coin counterfeited, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Possession of counterfeit coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, is in possession of counterfeit coin, having known at the time when he became possessed thereof that it was counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Possession of counterfeit Myanmar coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, is in possession of counterfeit Myanmar coin, having known at the time when he became possessed thereof that it was counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Person employed in Mint knowingly issuing or abetting issue of coin as genuine which has not been issued by authority
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being employed in any Mint lawfully established in Myanmar or in any other country, knowingly issues or abets the issue of any coin as genuine which has not been issued by authority of the Government as coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Unlawfully taking coining instrument from Mint
metadata.text_en: Whoever, without lawful authority, takes out of any Mint lawfully established in Myanmar or in any other country, any coining instrument or material, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of coin
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly diminishes the weight of any coin, or alters the composition of any coin, with the intention that the same shall pass as coin of a different description, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of Myanmar coin
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly diminishes the weight of any Myanmar coin, or alters the composition of any Myanmar coin, with the intention that the same shall pass as Myanmar coin of a different description, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Altering appearance of coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
metadata.text_en: Whoever, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, alters the appearance of any coin, with the intention that the same shall pass as coin of a different description, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Altering appearance of Myanmar coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
metadata.text_en: Whoever, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, alters the appearance of any Myanmar coin, with the intention that the same shall pass as Myanmar coin of a different description, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Delivery of coin possessed with knowledge that it is altered
metadata.text_en: Whoever, having any coin which has been fraudulently or dishonestly diminished in weight or altered in composition or altered in appearance, which at the time of becoming possessed of it he knew to have been so diminished or altered, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers the same to any person, or attempts to induce any person to receive it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Having possession of coin known to be altered
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, is in possession of coin which has been fraudulently or dishonestly diminished in weight or altered in composition or altered in appearance, having known at the time when he became possessed thereof that it had been so diminished or altered, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Having possession of Myanmar coin known to be altered
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, is in possession of Myanmar coin which has been fraudulently or dishonestly diminished in weight or altered in composition or altered in appearance, having known at the time when he became possessed thereof that it had been so diminished or altered, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Delivery of coin to another possessed with knowledge that it is altered
metadata.text_en: Whoever, having any coin which has been fraudulently or dishonestly diminished in weight or altered in composition or altered in appearance, which at the time of becoming possessed of it he knew to have been so diminished or altered, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers the same to any person, or attempts to induce any person to receive it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Delivery of Myanmar coin to another possessed with knowledge that it is altered
metadata.text_en: Whoever, having any Myanmar coin which has been fraudulently or dishonestly diminished in weight or altered in composition or altered in appearance, which at the time of becoming possessed of it he knew to have been so diminished or altered, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers the same to any person, or attempts to induce any person to receive it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Counterfeiting Government stamp
metadata.text_en: Whoever counterfeits or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting any stamp issued by Government for the purpose of revenue, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Having possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting Government stamp
metadata.text_en: Whoever is in possession of any instrument or material for the purpose of using the same for counterfeiting any Government stamp, or knowing or having reason to believe that the same is intended to be used for that purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Government stamp
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes or mends, or performs any part of the process of making or mending, or buys, sells or disposes of, any instrument for the purpose of being used, or knowing or having reason to believe that the same is intended to be used, for the purpose of counterfeiting any Government stamp, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Sale of counterfeit Government stamp
metadata.text_en: Whoever sells, or offers for sale, any counterfeit stamp, knowing the same to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Having possession of counterfeit Government stamp
metadata.text_en: Whoever, without lawful excuse, has in his possession any counterfeit Government stamp, knowing the same to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Using as genuine a Government stamp known to be counterfeit
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or with intent to cause loss to Government, uses as genuine any stamp knowing it to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Effacing writing from substance bearing Government stamp, or removing from document a stamp used for it, with intent to cause loss to Government
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or with intent to cause loss to Government, takes or removes from any substance bearing any stamp issued by Government for the purpose of revenue, any writing or impression, or removes from any document a stamp used for it, with intent that such stamp may be used again for the same or a different purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Having possession of instrument for effacing writing from substance bearing Government stamp, or removing from document a stamp used for it, with intent to cause loss to Government
metadata.text_en: Whoever, without lawful excuse, has in his possession any instrument or material for the purpose of effacing writing from substance bearing any stamp issued by Government for the purpose of revenue, or for removing from any document a stamp used for it, with intent that such stamp may be used again for the same or a different purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Fraudulently or dishonestly using a Government stamp which has been effaced from substance bearing Government stamp, or removed from document a stamp used for it, with intent to cause loss to Government
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or with intent to cause loss to Government, uses as genuine any stamp knowing it to have been effaced from substance bearing Government stamp, or removed from document a stamp used for it, with intent that such stamp may be used again for the same or a different purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Fraudulent use of false instrument for weighing
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently uses any instrument for weighing which he knows to be false, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Fraudulent use of false measure of length or capacity
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently uses any false measure of length or capacity, or any false weight, knowing the same to be false, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Being in possession of false weights or measures
metadata.text_en: Whoever is in possession of any instrument for weighing or any measure of length or capacity, or any weight, which he knows to be false, and intending that the same may be fraudulently used, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Making or selling false weight or measure
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes, sells or disposes of any instrument for weighing, or any measure of length or capacity, or any weight, which he knows to be false, and intending that the same may be fraudulently used, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Public nuisance
metadata.text_en: A person is guilty of a public nuisance who does any act, or is guilty of any illegal omission, which causes any common injury, danger or annoyance to the public or to the people in general who dwell or occupy property in the vicinity, or which must necessarily cause injury, obstruction, danger or annoyance to persons who may have occasion to use any public right.

metadata.title_en: Negligent act likely to spread infection of any disease dangerous to life
metadata.text_en: Whoever negligently does any act which is, and which he knows or has reason to believe to be, likely to spread the infection of any disease dangerous to life, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Malignant act likely to spread infection of any disease dangerous to life
metadata.text_en: Whoever malignantly does any act which is, and which he knows or has reason to believe to be, likely to spread the infection of any disease dangerous to life, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Disobedience to a quarantine rule
metadata.text_en: Whoever knowingly disobeys any rule made and promulgated by the Government for putting any vessel into a state of quarantine, or for regulating the intercourse of persons on board any vessel into a state of quarantine, or for regulating the intercourse of persons on board any vessel arriving at or departing from any port or place in Myanmar with any other persons, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to two thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Adulteration of food or drink intended for sale
metadata.text_en: Whoever adulterates any article of food or drink, so as to make such article noxious as food or drink, intending to sell such article as food or drink, or knowing it to be likely that the same will be sold as food or drink, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Sale of noxious food or drink
metadata.text_en: Whoever sells, or offers for sale, as food or drink, any article which has been rendered or has become noxious, or is in a state unfit for food or drink, knowing or having reason to believe that the same is noxious as food or drink, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Adulteration of drugs
metadata.text_en: Whoever adulterates any drug or medical preparation in such a manner as to lessen the efficacy or change the operation of such drug or medical preparation, or to make it noxious, intending that it shall be sold or used for any medicinal purpose as if it had not been adulterated, or knowing it to be likely that it will be sold or used for any medicinal purpose as if it had not been adulterated, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Sale of adulterated drugs
metadata.text_en: Whoever knowingly sells, or offers for sale, any drug or medical preparation, as if it had not been adulterated, which has been adulterated in such a manner as to lessen its efficacy, or to change its operation, or to make it noxious, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Sale of a different drug or medical preparation as a different drug or medical preparation
metadata.text_en: Whoever knowingly sells, or offers for sale, any drug or medical preparation as a different drug or medical preparation, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Fouling water of public spring or reservoir
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily corrupts or fouls the water of any public spring or reservoir, so as to render it less fit for the purpose for which it is ordinarily used, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Making atmosphere noxious to health
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily vitiates the atmosphere in any place so as to make it noxious to the health of persons in general dwelling or carrying on business in the neighborhood or passing along a public way, shall be punished with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats.

metadata.title_en: Rash driving or riding on a public way
metadata.text_en: Whoever drives any vehicle, or rides, on any public way in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Rash navigation of vessel
metadata.text_en: Whoever navigates any vessel in a manner so rash or negligent as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Exhibition of false light or mark for navigation
metadata.text_en: Whoever exhibits any false light or mark, or removes, alters or interferes with any light or mark, used for the guidance of any navigator, intending or knowing it to be likely that such exhibition, removal, alteration or interference will endanger the safety of any vessel, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Conveying person by water for hire in an overloaded or unsafe vessel
metadata.text_en: Whoever knowingly or negligently conveys, or causes to be conveyed, for hire, any person by water in any vessel, when that vessel is in such a state or so laden as to endanger the life of the person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Danger or obstruction in public way or navigation
metadata.text_en: Whoever, by doing any act, or by omitting to take order with any property in his possession or under his charge, causes danger, obstruction or injury to any person in any public way or public line of navigation, or unlawfully causes danger, obstruction or injury to any person in any public way or public line of navigation, shall be punished with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats.

metadata.title_en: Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substance
metadata.text_en: Whoever does any act in such a manner as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any person, by negligently using any poisonous substance, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter
metadata.text_en: Whoever does any act in such a manner as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any person, by negligently dealing with fire or any combustible matter, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Negligent conduct with respect to explosive substance
metadata.text_en: Whoever does any act in such a manner as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any person, by negligently dealing with any explosive substance, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Negligent conduct with respect to machinery
metadata.text_en: Whoever does any act in such a manner as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any person, by negligently dealing with any machinery, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Negligent conduct with respect to pulling down or repairing buildings
metadata.text_en: Whoever, in pulling down or repairing any building, does any act in such a manner as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any person, by negligently doing so, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Negligent conduct with respect to animal
metadata.text_en: Whoever negligently omits to take such order with any animal in his possession as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life, or any probable danger of grievous hurt from such animal, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided for
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits a public nuisance in any case not otherwise provided for in this Code, shall be punished with fine which may extend to two hundred kyats.

metadata.title_en: Continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue
metadata.text_en: Whoever repeats or continues a public nuisance, having been enjoined by any competent authority not to repeat or continue such nuisance, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Sale of obscene books, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever— (a) sells, lets to hire, distributes, exhibits or circulates, or for purposes of sale, hire, distribution, public exhibition or circulation, makes, produces or has in his possession any obscene book, pamphlet, paper, drawing, painting, representation or figure or any other obscene object whatsoever; or (b) imports, exports or conveys any obscene object for any of the purposes aforesaid, or knowing or having reason to believe that such object will be sold, let to hire, distributed or publicly exhibited or in any manner circulated; or (c) takes part in or receives profits from any business in the course of which he knows or has reason to believe that any such obscene objects are for any of the purposes aforesaid, made, produced, purchased, kept, imported, exported, conveyed, distributed or publicly exhibited, or in any manner circulated ; or (d) advertises or makes known by any means whatsoever that any person is engaged or is ready to engage in any act which is an offence under this section, or that any such obscene object can be procured or obtained by any means whatsoever; or (e) offers or attempts to do any act which is an offence under this section, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Having possession of obscene books, etc., for sale
metadata.text_en: Whoever has in his possession any obscene book, pamphlet, paper, drawing, painting, representation or figure or any other obscene object whatsoever, for the purpose of sale, hire, distribution, public exhibition or circulation, or knowing or having reason to believe that such object is intended for any of the aforesaid purposes, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Obscene acts and songs
metadata.text_en: Whoever, to the annoyance of others,— (a) does any obscene act in any public place ; or (b) sings, recites or utters any obscene song, ballad or words, in or near any public place, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Keeping lottery office
metadata.text_en: Whoever keeps any office or place for the purpose of drawing any lottery not authorized by the Government, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Publishing proposal relating to lotteries
metadata.text_en: Whoever publishes any proposal, either for the advancement or for the publishing of any lottery, not authorized by the Government, shall be punished with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats.

metadata.title_en: Injuring or defiling place of worship, with intent to insult the religion of any class
metadata.text_en: Whoever destroys, damages or defiles any place of worship, or any object held sacred by any class of persons, with the intention of thereby insulting the religion of any class of persons, or with the knowledge that any class of persons is likely to consider such destruction, damage or defilement as an insult to their religion, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Deliberate and malicious acts intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs
metadata.text_en: Whoever, with deliberate and malicious intention of outraging the religious feelings of any class of persons, by words, either spoken or written, or by signs or by visible representations or otherwise, insults or attempts to insult the religion or the religious beliefs of that class, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Disturbing religious assembly
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes disturbance to any assembly lawfully engaged in the performance of religious worship or religious ceremonies, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Trespassing on burial places, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever, with the intention of wounding the feelings of any person, or of insulting the religion of any person, or with the knowledge that the feelings of any person are likely to be wounded, or that the religion of any person is likely to be insulted, commits any trespass in any place of worship or on any place of sepulture or any place set apart for the performance of funeral rites or as a depository for the remains of the dead, or offers any indignity to any human corpse, or causes disturbance to any persons assembled for the performance of funeral rites, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Uttering words, etc., with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings
metadata.text_en: Whoever, with the deliberate intention of wounding the religious feelings of any person, utters any word or makes any sound in the hearing of that person or makes any gesture in the sight of that person or places any object in the sight of that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Culpable homicide
metadata.text_en: Whoever causes death by doing an act with the intention of causing death, or with the intention of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, or with the knowledge that he is likely by such act to cause death, commits the offence of culpable homicide.

metadata.title_en: Murder
metadata.text_en: Except in the cases hereinafter excepted, culpable homicide is murder,—Firstly.—If the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death; or Secondly.—If it is done with the intention of causing such bodily injury as the offender knows to be likely to cause the death of the person to whom the harm is caused; or Thirdly.—If it is done with the intention of causing bodily injury to any person and the bodily injury intended to be inflicted is sufficient in the ordinary course of nature to cause death; or Fourthly.—If the person committing the act knows that it is so imminently dangerous that it must in all probability cause death, or such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, and commits such act without any excuse for incurring the risk of causing death or such injury as aforesaid.

metadata.title_en: Culpable homicide by causing death of person other than person whose death was intended
metadata.text_en: If a person, by doing anything which he intends or knows to be likely to cause death, commits culpable homicide by causing the death of any person whose death he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause, the culpable homicide committed by the offender is of the description of which it would have been if he had caused the death of the person whose death he intended or knew himself to be likely to cause.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for murder
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death, or transportation for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for murder by a life-convict
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being under sentence of transportation for life, commits murder, shall be punished with death.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits culpable homicide not amounting to murder, shall be punished with transportation for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death, or of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death; or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, or with fine, or with both, if the act is done with the knowledge that it is likely to cause death, but without any intention to cause death, or to cause such bodily injury as is likely to cause death.

metadata.title_en: Causing death by negligence
metadata.text_en: Whoever causes the death of any person by doing any rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Abetment of suicide of child or insane person
metadata.text_en: If any person under eighteen years of age, or any insane person, or any delirious person, or any idiot, or any person in a state of intoxication, commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide, shall be punished with death or transportation for life, or imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Abetment of suicide
metadata.text_en: If any person commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Attempt to murder
metadata.text_en: Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if hurt is caused to any person by such act, the offender shall be liable either to transportation for life, or to imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years.

metadata.title_en: Attempt to commit culpable homicide
metadata.text_en: Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of culpable homicide not amounting to murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and if hurt is caused to any person by such act, the offender shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Attempt to commit suicide
metadata.text_en: Whoever attempts to commit suicide, and does any act towards the commission of such offence, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Thug
metadata.text_en: Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, shall have been habitually associated with any other or others for the purpose of committing robbery or child-stealing by means of or accompanied with murder, is a thug.

metadata.title_en: Punishment
metadata.text_en: Whoever is a thug, shall be punished with transportation for life.

metadata.title_en: Causing miscarriage
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes a woman with child to miscarry, shall, if such miscarriage be not caused in good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the woman, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and if the woman is quick with child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Causing miscarriage without woman’s consent
