metadata.text_en: Whoever, with intent to cause the miscarriage of a woman with child, does any act which causes miscarriage without the consent of such woman, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage
metadata.text_en: Whoever, with intent to cause miscarriage of a woman with child, does any act which causes the death of such woman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if the act is done without the consent of the woman, shall be punished either with transportation for life, or with the punishment above mentioned.

metadata.title_en: Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive or to cause it to die after birth
metadata.text_en: Whoever before the birth of any child does any act with the intention of thereby preventing that child from being born alive or causing it to die after its birth, and does by such act prevent that child from being born alive, or causes it to die after its birth, shall, if such act be not caused in good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the mother, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Causing death of quick unborn child by act amounting to culpable homicide
metadata.text_en: Whoever does any act under such circumstances that, if he thereby caused death, he would be guilty of culpable homicide, and does by such act cause the death of a quick unborn child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Exposure and abandonment of child under twelve years by parent or person having care of it
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being the father or mother of a child under the age of twelve years, or having the care of such child, shall expose or leave such child in any place with the intention of wholly abandoning such child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body
metadata.text_en: Whoever, by secretly burying or otherwise disposing of the dead body of a child, whether such child died before or after or during its birth, intentionally conceals or endeavours to conceal the birth of such child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Hurt
metadata.text_en: Whoever causes bodily pain, disease or infirmity to any person is said to cause hurt.

metadata.title_en: Grievous hurt
metadata.text_en: The following kinds of hurt only are designated as "grievous":"Firstly.—Emasculation Secondly.—Permanent privation of the sight of either eye. Thirdly.—Permanent privation of the hearing of either ear. Fourthly.—Privation of any member or joint. Fifthly.—Destruction or permanent impairing of the powers of any member or joint. Sixthly.—Permanent disfiguration of the head or face. Seventhly.—Fracture or dislocation of a bone or tooth. Eighthly.—Any hurt which endangers life, or which causes the sufferer to be during the space of twenty days in severe bodily pain, or unable to follow his ordinary pursuits.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing hurt
metadata.text_en: Whoever does any act with the intention of thereby causing hurt to any person, or with the knowledge that he is likely thereby to cause hurt to any person, and does thereby cause hurt to any person, is said "voluntarily to cause hurt."

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt, if the hurt which he intends to cause or knows himself to be likely to cause is grievous hurt, and if the hurt which he causes is grievous hurt, is said “voluntarily to cause grievous hurt”

metadata.title_en: Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt
metadata.text_en: Whoever, except in the case provided for by section 334, voluntarily causes hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means
metadata.text_en: Whoever, except in the case provided for by section 334, voluntarily causes hurt by means of any instrument for shooting, stabbing or cutting, or any instrument which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, or by means of fire or any heated substance, or any poison or any corrosive substance, or by means of any explosive substance, or by means of any substance which it is deleterious to the human body to inhale, to swallow, or to receive into the blood, or by means of any animal, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt
metadata.text_en: Whoever, except in the case provided for by section 335, voluntarily causes grievous hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means
metadata.text_en: Whoever, except in the case provided for by section 335, voluntarily causes grievous hurt by means of any instrument for shooting, stabbing or cutting, or any instrument which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, or by means of fire or any heated substance, or any poison or any corrosive substance, or by means of any explosive substance, or by means of any substance which it is deleterious to the human body to inhale, to swallow, or to receive into the blood, or by means of any animal, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to any person being a public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that person or any other public servant from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything done or attempted to be done by that person as such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Causing hurt by means of poison, etc., with intent to commit an offence
metadata.text_en: Whoever administers to or causes to be taken by any person any poison or any intoxicating, or any unwholesome drug, or other thing, with intent to cause hurt to such person, or with intent to commit or to facilitate the commission of an offence or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer, or from any person interested in the sufferer, any property or valuable security, or of constraining the sufferer, or any person interested in the sufferer, to do anything which is illegal or which may facilitate the commission of an offence, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer, or from any person interested in the sufferer, any confession or any information which may lead to the detection of an offence or misconduct, or for the purpose of compelling the sufferer or any person interested in the sufferer to restore or to cause the restoration of any property or valuable security, or to satisfy any claim or demand, or to give information which may lead to the restoration of any property or valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer, or from any person interested in the sufferer, any confession or any information which may lead to the detection of an offence or misconduct, or for the purpose of compelling the sufferer or any person interested in the sufferer to restore or to cause the restoration of any property or valuable security, or to satisfy any claim or demand, or to give information which may lead to the restoration of any property or valuable security, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to any person, being a public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that person or any other public servant from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything done or attempted to be done by that person as such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to any person, being a public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that person or any other public servant from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything done or attempted to be done by that person as such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing hurt on provocation
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt on grave and sudden provocation, if he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause hurt to any person other than the person who gave the provocation, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to two hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt on provocation
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation, if he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause grievous hurt to any person other than the person who gave the provocation, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to four years, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Act endangering life or personal safety of others
metadata.text_en: Whoever does any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life, or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
metadata.text_en: Whoever causes hurt to any person by doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life, or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
metadata.text_en: Whoever causes grievous hurt to any person by doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life, or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Wrongful restraint
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily obstructs any person so as to prevent that person from proceeding in any direction in which that person has a right to proceed, is said wrongfully to restrain that person.

metadata.title_en: Wrongful confinement
metadata.text_en: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person in such a manner as to prevent that person from proceeding beyond certain circumscribing limits, is said "wrongfully to confine" that person.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for wrongful restraint
metadata.text_en: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to two hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for wrongful confinement
metadata.text_en: Whoever wrongfully confines any person shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Wrongful confinement for three or more days
metadata.text_en: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for three or more days, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Wrongful confinement for ten or more days
metadata.text_en: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for ten or more days, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Wrongful confinement of person for whose liberation writ has been issued
metadata.text_en: Whoever keeps any person in wrongful confinement, knowing that a writ for the liberation of that person has been duly issued, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, in addition to any term of imprisonment to which he may be liable under any other section of this Code for the wrongful confinement.

metadata.title_en: Wrongful confinement in secret
metadata.text_en: Whoever wrongfully confines any person in such manner as to indicate an intention that the confinement of such person may not be known to any person interested in the person so confined, or to any public servant, or that the place of such confinement may not be known to or discovered by any such person or public servant as aforesaid, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, in addition to any other punishment to which he may be liable for such wrongful confinement.

metadata.title_en: Wrongful confinement to extort property, or constrain to illegal act
metadata.text_en: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for the purpose of extorting from the confined person, or from any person interested in the confined person, any property or valuable security, or of constraining the confined person, or any person interested in the confined person, to do anything which is illegal or which may facilitate the commission of an offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Wrongful confinement to extort confession, or compel restoration of property
metadata.text_en: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for the purpose of extorting from the confined person, or from any person interested in the confined person, any confession or any information which may lead to the detection of an offence or misconduct, or for the purpose of compelling the confined person, or any person interested in the confined person, to restore or to cause the restoration of any property or valuable security, or to satisfy any claim or demand, or to give information which may lead to the restoration of any property or valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Force
metadata.text_en: A person is said to use force to another person if he causes motion, change of motion, or cessation of motion to that other, or if he causes to any substance such motion, or change of motion, or cessation of motion as brings that substance into contact with any part of that other's body, or with anything which that other is wearing or carrying, or with anything which is so situated that such contact affects that other's sense of touch, and does so by his own bodily power, or by disposing any substance in such a manner that the motion or cessation of motion of that substance is produced without further act on his part, or by inducing any animal to move, to change its motion, or to cease to move.

metadata.title_en: Criminal force
metadata.text_en: Whoever intentionally uses force to any person, without that person's consent, in order to the committing of any offence, or intending by the use of such force to cause injury, fear or annoyance to the person to whom the force is used, is said to use criminal force to that other.

metadata.title_en: Assault
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes any gesture, or any preparation intending or knowing it to be likely that such gesture or preparation will cause any person present to apprehend that he who makes that gesture or preparation is about to use criminal force to that person, is said to commit an “assault”.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation
metadata.text_en: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty
metadata.text_en: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that person or any other public servant from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything done or attempted to be done by that person in the lawful discharge of his duty as such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty
metadata.text_en: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any woman, intending to outrage or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby outrage her modesty, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonour person, otherwise than on grave provocation
metadata.text_en: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property carried by a person
metadata.text_en: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Assault or criminal force in attempt wrongfully to confine a person
metadata.text_en: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to one thousand kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Assault or criminal force on grave provocation
metadata.text_en: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to two hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Kidnapping
metadata.text_en: Kidnapping is of two kinds: kidnapping from Myanmar, and kidnapping from lawful guardianship.

metadata.title_en: Kidnapping from Myanmar
metadata.text_en: Whoever conveys any person beyond the limits of Myanmar without the consent of that person, or of some person legally authorized to consent on behalf of that person, is said to kidnap that person from Myanmar.

metadata.title_en: Kidnapping from lawful guardianship
metadata.text_en: Whoever takes or entices any minor under fourteen years of age if a male, or under sixteen years of age if a female, or any person of unsound mind, out of the keeping of the lawful guardian of such minor or person of unsound mind, without the consent of such guardian, is said to kidnap such minor or person from lawful guardianship.

metadata.title_en: Abduction
metadata.text_en: Whoever by force compels, or by any deceitful means induces, any person to go from any place, is said to abduct that person.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for kidnapping
metadata.text_en: Whoever kidnaps any person from Myanmar or from lawful guardianship, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Kidnapping or abducting in order to murder
metadata.text_en: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person in order that such person may be murdered, or may be so disposed of as to be put in danger of being murdered, shall be punished with transportation for life, or rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Kidnapping or abducting with intent secretly and wrongfully to confine person
metadata.text_en: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person with intent to cause that person to be secretly and wrongfully confined, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel her to marry, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any woman with intent that she may be compelled, or knowing it to be likely that she will be compelled, to marry any person against her will, or to be forced or seduced to illicit intercourse, or knowing it to be likely that she will be forced or seduced to illicit intercourse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and whoever by means of criminal intimidation or of abuse of authority or any other method of compulsion, induces any woman to go from any place with intent that she may be, or knowing that it is likely that she will be, forced or seduced to illicit intercourse, shall be punished as aforesaid.

metadata.title_en: Procuration of minor girl
metadata.text_en: Whoever by any means whatsoever induces any minor girl under the age of eighteen years to go from any place or to do any act with intent that such girl may be, or knowing that it is likely that she will be, forced or seduced to illicit intercourse with any person, whether in Myanmar or elsewhere, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Importation of girl from foreign country
metadata.text_en: Whoever imports into Myanmar from any country outside Myanmar any girl under the age of twenty-one years with intent that she may be, or knowing that it is likely that she will be, forced or seduced to illicit intercourse with any person, or for any unlawful and immoral purpose, or knowing that it is likely that she will be forced or seduced to illicit intercourse with any person or for any unlawful and immoral purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Kidnapping or abducting in order to subject person to grievous hurt, slavery, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person in order to subject that person to grievous hurt, or to slavery, or to the unnatural lust of any person, or knowing it to be likely that such person will be so subjected, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Wrongfully concealing or keeping in confinement kidnapped or abducted person
metadata.text_en: Whoever, knowing that any person has been kidnapped or has been abducted, wrongfully conceals or keeps such person in confinement, shall be punished in the same manner as if he had kidnapped or abducted such person with the same intention or knowledge, or for the same purpose as that with which he conceals or retains such person in confinement.

metadata.title_en: Kidnapping or abducting child under ten years with intent to steal from its person
metadata.text_en: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any child under the age of ten years with the intention of taking dishonestly any movable property from the person of such child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Buying or disposing of any person as a slave
metadata.text_en: Whoever habitually imports, exports, removes, buys, sells, traffics or deals in slaves, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term not exceeding ten years.

metadata.title_en: Habitual dealing in slaves
metadata.text_en: Whoever habitually imports, exports, removes, buys, sells, traffics or deals in slaves, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term not exceeding ten years.

metadata.title_en: Selling minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever sells, let to hire, or otherwise disposes of any person under the age of eighteen years with intent that such person shall at any age be employed or used for the purpose of prostitution or for any unlawful and immoral purpose, or knowing that such person is likely to be employed or used for any such purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Buying minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever buys, hires, or otherwise obtains possession of any person under the age of eighteen years with intent that such person shall at any age be employed or used for the purpose of prostitution or for any unlawful and immoral purpose, or knowing that such person is likely to be employed or used for any such purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Unlawful compulsory labour
metadata.text_en: Whoever unlawfully compels any person to labour against the will of that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Rape
metadata.text_en: A man is said to commit “rape” who has sexual intercourse with a woman under any of the following circumstances:Firstly.—Against her will. Secondly.—Without her consent. Thirdly.—With her consent, when her consent has been obtained by putting her in fear of death, or of hurt. Fourthly.—With her consent, when the man knows that he is not her husband, and that her consent is given because she believes that he is another man to whom she is or believes herself to be lawfully married. Fifthly.—With her consent, when, at the time of giving such consent, she is unable to understand the nature and consequences of that to which she gives consent. Sixthly.—With or without her consent, when she is under sixteen years of age.Explanation.—Penetration is sufficient to constitute the sexual intercourse necessary to the offence of rape.Exception.—Sexual intercourse by a man with his own wife is not rape.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for rape
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits rape shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Unnatural offences
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily has carnal intercourse against the order of nature with any man, woman or animal, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Theft
metadata.text_en: Whoever, intending to take dishonestly any movable property out of the possession of any person without that person's consent, moves that property in order to such taking, is said to commit “theft”.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for theft
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits theft shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Theft in dwelling-house, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits theft in any building, tent or vessel, which is used as a human dwelling, or for the custody of property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Theft by clerk or servant of property in possession of master
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a clerk or servant, or being employed in the capacity of a clerk or servant, commits theft in respect of any property in the possession of his master or employer, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Theft after preparation made for causing death, hurt or restraint in order to commit theft
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits theft, having made preparation for causing death, or hurt, or restraint, or fear of death, or of hurt, or of restraint, to any person, in order to commit such theft, or in order to effect his escape after committing such theft, or in order to retain property taken by such theft, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Extortion
metadata.text_en: Whoever intentionally puts any person in fear of any injury to that person, or to any other, and thereby dishonestly induces the person so put in fear to deliver to any person any property or valuable security, or anything signed or sealed which may be converted into a valuable security, commits “extortion”.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for extortion
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits extortion shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Putting person in fear of injury in order to commit extortion
metadata.text_en: Whoever, in order to commit extortion, puts any person in fear of any injury, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Extortion by putting person in fear of death or grievous hurt
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits extortion by putting any person in fear of death or of grievous hurt to that person or to any other, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Putting person in fear of death or of grievous hurt, in order to commit extortion
metadata.text_en: Whoever, in order to commit extortion, puts or attempts to put any person in fear of death or of grievous hurt to that person or to any other, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Extortion by threat of accusation of an offence punishable with death or transportation for life, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits extortion by putting any person in fear of an accusation against that person or any other, that such person or other has committed or attempted to commit any offence punishable with death, or with transportation for life, or with imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, or of an attempt to induce any other person to commit such offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Putting person in fear of accusation of offence, in order to commit extortion
metadata.text_en: Whoever, in order to commit extortion, puts or attempts to put any person in fear of an accusation, against that person or any other, that such person or other has committed, or attempted to commit, an offence punishable with death, or with transportation for life, or with imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, or of an attempt to induce any other person to commit such offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Robbery
metadata.text_en: In all robbery there is either theft or extortion.

metadata.title_en: Dacoity
metadata.text_en: When five or more persons conjointly commit or attempt to commit a robbery, or where the whole number of persons conjointly committing or attempting to commit a robbery, and persons present and aiding such commission or attempt, amount to five or more, every person so committing, attempting or aiding, is said to commit “dacoity”.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for robbery
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits robbery shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Attempt to commit robbery
metadata.text_en: Whoever attempts to commit robbery shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Voluntarily causing hurt in committing robbery
metadata.text_en: If any person, in committing or in attempting to commit robbery, voluntarily causes hurt, such person, and any other person jointly concerned in committing or attempting to commit such robbery, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for dacoity
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits dacoity shall be punished with transportation for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Dacoity with murder
metadata.text_en: If any one of five or more persons, who are conjointly committing dacoity, commits murder in so committing dacoity, every one of those persons shall be punished with death, or transportation for life, or rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Robbery or dacoity, with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt
metadata.text_en: If, at the time of committing robbery or dacoity, the offender uses any deadly weapon, or causes grievous hurt to any person, or attempts to cause death or grievous hurt to any person, the imprisonment with which such offender shall be punished shall not be less than seven years.

metadata.title_en: Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with deadly weapon
metadata.text_en: If, at the time of attempting to commit robbery or dacoity, the offender is armed with any deadly weapon, the imprisonment with which such offender shall be punished shall not be less than seven years.

metadata.title_en: Making preparation to commit dacoity
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes any preparation for committing dacoity, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for belonging to gang of dacoits
metadata.text_en: Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, shall belong to a gang of dacoits, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for belonging to gang of thieves
metadata.text_en: Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, shall belong to any wandering or other gang of persons associated for the purpose of habitually committing theft or robbery, and not being a gang of dacoits, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Assembling for purpose of committing dacoity
metadata.text_en: Whoever at any time after the passing of this Act shall be one of five or more persons assembled for the purpose of committing dacoity, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Dishonest misappropriation of property
metadata.text_en: Whoever dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his own use any movable property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Dishonest misappropriation of property possessed by deceased person at the time of his death
metadata.text_en: Whoever dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his own use property, knowing that such property was in the possession of a deceased person at the time of that person's decease, and has not since been in the possession of any person legally entitled to the possession of it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Criminal breach of trust
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being in any manner entrusted with property, or with any dominion over property, dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his own use that property, or dishonestly uses or disposes of that property in violation of any direction of law prescribing the mode in which such trust is to be discharged, or of any legal contract, express or implied, which he has made touching the discharge of such trust, or wilfully suffers any other person so to do, commits “criminal breach of trust”.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for criminal breach of trust
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits criminal breach of trust shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Criminal breach of trust by carrier, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being entrusted with property as a carrier, wharfinger or warehouse-keeper, commits criminal breach of trust in respect of such property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Criminal breach of trust by clerk or servant
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a clerk or servant, or employed as a clerk or servant, and being in any manner entrusted with property, or with any dominion over property, commits criminal breach of trust in respect of that property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Criminal breach of trust by public servant, or by banker, merchant or agent
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being in any manner entrusted with property, or with any dominion over property in his capacity of a public servant or in the way of his business as a banker, merchant, factor, broker, attorney or agent, commits criminal breach of trust in respect of that property, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Stolen property
metadata.text_en: Property, the possession whereof has been transferred by theft, or by extortion, or by robbery, and property which has been criminally misappropriated or in respect of which criminal breach of trust has been committed, is designated as “stolen property”, whether the transfer has been made or the misappropriation or breach of trust has been committed within or without Myanmar.

metadata.title_en: Dishonestly receiving stolen property
metadata.text_en: Whoever dishonestly receives or retains any stolen property, knowing or having reason to believe the same to be stolen property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Dishonestly receiving property stolen in the commission of a dacoity
metadata.text_en: Whoever dishonestly receives or retains any stolen property, the possession whereof he knows or has reason to believe to have been transferred by the commission of dacoity, or from any person by whom he knows or has reason to believe such property to have been transferred by the commission of dacoity, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Habitually dealing in stolen property
metadata.text_en: Whoever habitually receives or deals in property which he knows or has reason to believe to be stolen property, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Assisting in concealment of stolen property
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily assists in concealing or disposing of or making away with property which he knows or has reason to believe to be stolen property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Cheating
metadata.text_en: Whoever, by deceiving any person, fraudulently or dishonestly induces the person so deceived to deliver any property to any person, or to consent that any person shall retain any property, or intentionally induces the person so deceived to do or omit to do anything which he would not do or omit if he were not so deceived, and which act or omission causes or is likely to cause damage or harm to that person in body, mind, reputation or property, is said to “cheat”.

metadata.title_en: Cheating by personation
metadata.text_en: A person is said to “cheat by personation” if he cheats by pretending to be some other person, or by knowingly substituting one person for another, or representing that he or any other person is a person other than he or such other person really is.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for cheating
metadata.text_en: Whoever cheats shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Cheating with knowledge that wrongful loss may ensue to person whose interest offender is bound to protect
metadata.text_en: Whoever cheats with the knowledge that he is likely thereby to cause wrongful loss to a person whose interest in the transaction to which the cheating relates, he was bound, either by law, or by a legal contract, to protect, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for cheating by personation
metadata.text_en: Whoever cheats by personation shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property
metadata.text_en: Whoever cheats and thereby dishonestly induces the person deceived to deliver any property to any person, or to make, alter or destroy the whole or any part of a valuable security, or anything which is signed or sealed, and which is capable of being converted into a valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent distribution among creditors
metadata.text_en: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently removes, conceals or delivers to any person, or transfers or causes to be transferred to any person, any property, intending thereby to prevent, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby prevent, the distribution of that property according to law among his creditors, or among such of his creditors as receive a dividend, or intending thereby to prevent, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby prevent, any of his creditors from enforcing any right or remedy against him or against the property in respect of such property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Dishonest or fraudulent execution of deed of transfer containing false statement of consideration
metadata.text_en: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently signs, executes, or becomes a party to any deed or instrument which purports to transfer or subject to any charge any property, or any interest therein, and which contains any false statement relating to the consideration for such transfer or charge, or relating to the person or persons for whose use or benefit it is really intended to operate, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Dishonest or fraudulent execution of deed of transfer containing false statement of consideration
metadata.text_en: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently signs, executes, or becomes a party to any deed or instrument which purports to transfer or subject to any charge any property, or any interest therein, and which contains any false statement relating to the consideration for such transfer or charge, or relating to the person or persons for whose use or benefit it is really intended to operate, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property
metadata.text_en: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently conceals or removes any property of himself or any other person, or dishonestly or fraudulently assists in the concealment or removal thereof, or dishonestly releases any demand or claim to which he is entitled, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Mischief
metadata.text_en: Whoever with intent to cause, or knowing that he is likely to cause, wrongful loss or damage to the public or to any person, causes the destruction of any property, or any such change in any property or in the situation thereof as destroys or diminishes its value or utility, or affects it injuriously, commits “mischief”.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for mischief
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Mischief causing damage to amount of fifty kyats
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief and thereby causes loss or damage to the amount of fifty kyats or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Mischief by killing or maiming animal of the value of ten kyats
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief by killing, poisoning, maiming or rendering useless any animal or animals of the value of ten kyats or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Mischief by killing or maiming cattle, etc., of any value
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief by killing, poisoning, maiming or rendering useless, any elephant, camel, horse, mule, buffalo, bull, cow or ox, whatever may be the value thereof, or any other animal of the value of fifty kyats or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Mischief by causing diminution of supply of water for agricultural purposes, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief by doing any act which causes or is likely to cause diminution of the supply of water for agricultural purposes, or for food or drink for human beings or for animals which are kept for consumption or for agriculture, or for cleansing or for carrying timber or other merchandize, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Mischief by injury to public road, bridge, river or channel
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief by doing any act which renders, or which he knows to be likely to render, any public road, bridge, navigable river or navigable channel, natural or artificial, impassable or less safe for passing, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Mischief by causing inundation or obstruction to public drainage attended with damage
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief by doing any act which causes or which he knows to be likely to cause inundation or an obstruction to any public drainage attended with injury or damage, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Mischief by destroying, moving or rendering less useful a lighthouse or sea-mark
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief by destroying, moving or rendering less useful any lighthouse or other sea-mark placed as a guide for navigators, or any floating signal or other device used for a like purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Mischief by destroying or moving, etc., a landmark fixed by public authority
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief by destroying or moving any landmark fixed by the authority of a public servant, or by any act which renders such landmark less useful as such, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Mischief by exploding substance with intent to cause damage to amount of one hundred kyats
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief by fire or any explosive substance, intending to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, damage to any property to the amount of one hundred kyats or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy house, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief by fire or any explosive substance, intending to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, the destruction of any building which is ordinarily used as a human dwelling or as a place for the custody of property, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Mischief with intent to destroy or make unsafe a decked vessel or one of twenty tons burden
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief to any decked vessel or any vessel of a burden of twenty tons or upwards, intending to destroy or render unsafe that vessel, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby destroy or render unsafe that vessel, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy a decked vessel or one of twenty tons burden
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief by fire or any explosive substance, intending to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, the destruction of any decked vessel or any vessel of a burden of twenty tons or upwards, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for intentionally running vessel aground or ashore with intent to commit theft, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever intentionally runs any vessel aground or ashore, intending to commit theft or any other offence punishable under this Code, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Mischief committed after preparation for causing death or hurt
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits mischief, having made preparation for causing to any person death or hurt, or wrongful restraint, or fear of death or of hurt, or of wrongful restraint, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Criminal trespass
metadata.text_en: Whoever enters into or upon property in the possession of another with intent to commit an offence or to intimidate, insult or annoy any person in possession of such property, or having lawfully entered into or upon such property, unlawfully remains there with intent thereby to intimidate, insult or annoy any such person, or with intent to commit an offence, is said to commit “criminal trespass”.

metadata.title_en: House-trespass
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits criminal trespass by entering into or remaining in any building, tent or vessel used as a human dwelling or any building used as a place for worship, or as a place for the custody of property, is said to commit “house-trespass”.

metadata.title_en: Lurking house-trespass
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits house-trespass having taken precautions to conceal such house-trespass from any person who has a right to exclude or eject the trespasser from the building, tent or vessel which is the subject of the trespass, is said to commit “lurking house-trespass”.

metadata.title_en: Lurking house-trespass by night
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass after sunset and before sunrise, is said to commit “lurking house-trespass by night”.

metadata.title_en: House-breaking
metadata.text_en: A person is said to commit “house-breaking” who commits house-trespass if he effects his entrance into the house or any part of it in any of the six ways hereinafter described, or if he effects his exit from the house or any part of it in any of the six ways hereinafter described.

metadata.title_en: House-breaking by night
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits house-breaking after sunset and before sunrise, is said to commit “house-breaking by night”.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for criminal trespass
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits criminal trespass shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for house-trespass
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits house-trespass shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: House-trespass in order to commit offence punishable with death
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits house-trespass in order to commit any offence punishable with death, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: House-trespass in order to commit offence punishable with transportation for life or imprisonment
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits house-trespass in order to commit any offence punishable with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term not exceeding ten years, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: House-trespass in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits house-trespass in order to commit any offence punishable with imprisonment, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if the offence intended to be committed is theft, the term of the imprisonment may be extended to seven years.

metadata.title_en: House-trespass after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits house-trespass, having made preparation for causing to any person hurt, or for assaulting any person, or for wrongfully restraining any person, or for putting any person in fear of hurt, or of assault, or of wrongful restraint, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for lurking house-trespass or house-breaking
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking in order to commit any offence punishable with imprisonment, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if the offence intended to be committed is theft, the term of the imprisonment may be extended to ten years.

metadata.title_en: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, having made preparation for causing to any person hurt, or for assaulting any person, or for wrongfully restraining any person, or for putting any person in fear of hurt, or of assault, or of wrongful restraint, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night, in order to commit any offence punishable with imprisonment, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if the offence intended to be committed is theft, the term of the imprisonment may be extended to fourteen years.

metadata.title_en: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night, having made preparation for causing to any person hurt, or for assaulting any person, or for wrongfully restraining any person, or for putting any person in fear of hurt, or of assault, or of wrongful restraint, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to fourteen years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Grievous hurt caused whilst committing lurking house-trespass or house-breaking
metadata.text_en: Whoever, whilst committing lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, causes grievous hurt to any person or attempts to cause death or grievous hurt to any person, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: All persons jointly concerned in lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night punishable for death or grievous hurt caused by one of them
metadata.text_en: If at the time of the committing of lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night, any person guilty of such offence shall voluntarily cause or attempt to cause death or grievous hurt to any person, every person jointly concerned in committing such lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Dishonestly breaking open receptacle containing property
metadata.text_en: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently breaks open or unfastens any closed receptacle which contains or which he believes to contain property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for same by person entrusted with custody
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being entrusted with any closed receptacle which contains or which he believes to contain property, or being entrusted with the custody of property, of which such closed receptacle forms a part, dishonestly or fraudulently breaks open or unfastens that receptacle, or allows the same to be broken open or unfastened, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Forgery
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes any false document or false electronic record or part of a document or electronic record, with intent to cause damage or injury to the public or to any person, or to support any claim or title, or to cause any person to part with property, or to enter into any express or implied contract, or with intent to commit fraud or that fraud may be committed, commits “forgery”.

metadata.title_en: Making a false document
metadata.text_en: A person is said to make a false document—Firstly, who dishonestly or fraudulently makes, signs, seals or executes a document or part of a document, or makes any mark denoting the execution of a document, with the intention of causing it to be believed that such document or part of a document was made, signed, sealed or executed by or by the authority of a person by whom or by whose authority he knows that it was not made, signed, sealed or executed, or at a time at which he knows that it was not made, signed, sealed or executed; or Secondly, who, without lawful authority, dishonestly or fraudulently by cancellation or otherwise, alters a document in any material part thereof, after it has been made or executed either by himself or by any other person, with or without the consent of that person, and whether such document in its original form or so altered, is a valuable security or not; or Thirdly, who dishonestly or fraudulently causes any person to sign, seal, execute or alter a document, knowing that such person by reason of unsoundness of mind or intoxication, or that the person understands the character of the document, or the amount of consent which he gives to it, to be different from what he means it to be.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for forgery
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits forgery shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Forgery of record of Court or of public register, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever forges a document or an electronic record, purporting to be a record or proceeding of or in a Court of Justice, or a register of birth, baptism, marriage or burial, or a register kept by a public servant as such, or a certificate or document purporting to be made by a public servant in his official capacity, or an authority to institute or defend a suit, or to take any proceedings therein, or to confess judgment, or a power of attorney, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Forgery of valuable security, will, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever forges a document or an electronic record, purporting to be a valuable security or a will, or an authority to adopt a son, or an authority to make or transfer any valuable security, or to receive the principal money, interest or dividends thereon, or to receive or deliver any movable property, or any acquittance or receipt acknowledging the payment of money or the delivery of any movable property, shall be punished with transportation for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Forgery for purpose of cheating
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits forgery, intending that the document or electronic record forged shall be used for the purpose of cheating, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Forgery for purpose of harming reputation
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits forgery, intending that the document or electronic record forged shall harm the reputation of any party, or knowing that it is likely to be used for that purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Forged document
metadata.text_en: A false document or electronic record made wholly or in part by forgery is designated “a forged document” or “a forged electronic record”.

metadata.title_en: Using as genuine a forged document
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly uses as genuine any document or electronic record which he knows or has reason to believe to be a forged document or electronic record, shall be punished in the same manner as if he had forged such document or electronic record.

metadata.title_en: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, etc., with intent to commit forgery punishable under section 467
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes or counterfeits any seal, plate or other instrument for making an impression, or any mark or image, intending that the same shall be used for the purpose of committing any forgery which would be punishable under section 467 of this Code, or with such intent has in his possession any such seal, plate or other instrument, knowing the same to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, etc., with intent to commit forgery punishable otherwise
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes or counterfeits any seal, plate or other instrument for making an impression, or any mark or image, intending that the same shall be used for the purpose of committing any forgery which would be punishable under any section of this Code other than section 467, or with such intent has in his possession any such seal, plate or other instrument, knowing the same to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Having possession of document knowing it to be forged and intending to use it as genuine
metadata.text_en: Whoever has in his possession any document or electronic record, knowing the same to be forged, and intending that the same shall be fraudulently or dishonestly used as genuine, shall, if the document or electronic record is one of the description mentioned in section 466 of this Code, be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if the document or electronic record is one of the description mentioned in section 467, be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if the document or electronic record is one of the description mentioned in section 468, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if the document or electronic record is one of the description mentioned in section 469, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Counterfeiting device or mark used for authenticating documents described in section 467, or possessing counterfeit marked material
metadata.text_en: Whoever counterfeits upon, or in the substance of, any material any device or mark used for the purpose of authenticating any document or electronic record described in section 467 of this Code, or any part of such device or mark, intending that such counterfeit device or mark shall be used for the purpose of giving authenticity to any document or electronic record then forged or thereafter to be forged, or has in his possession any such material bearing such counterfeit device or mark, knowing the same to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Counterfeiting device or mark used for authenticating documents other than those described in section 467, or possessing counterfeit marked material
metadata.text_en: Whoever counterfeits upon, or in the substance of, any material any device or mark used for the purpose of authenticating any document or electronic record other than a document or electronic record described in section 467 of this Code, or any part of such device or mark, intending that such counterfeit device or mark shall be used for the purpose of giving authenticity to any document or electronic record then forged or thereafter to be forged, or has in his possession any such material bearing such counterfeit device or mark, knowing the same to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Fraudulently cancelling, destroying, etc., will, authority to adopt, or valuable security
metadata.text_en: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly, or with intent to cause damage or injury to the public or to any person, cancels, destroys or defaces, or attempts to cancel, destroy or deface, or secretes any document or electronic record purporting to be a will, or an authority to adopt a son, or any valuable security, or commits mischief in respect to such document or electronic record, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Falsification of accounts
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a clerk, officer or servant, or employed or acting in the capacity of a clerk, officer or servant, wilfully and with intent to defraud, destroy, alter, mutilate or falsify any book, paper, writing, valuable security or account belonging to or in the possession of his employer, or received by him for or on behalf of his employer, or wilfully and with intent to defraud, make or abet the making of any false entry in, or omit or alter, or abet the omission or alteration of, any material particular from or in any such book, paper, writing, valuable security or account, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Trade mark
metadata.text_en: A mark used for the purpose of indicating that some goods are the manufacture or merchandise of a particular person or company or that they are goods of a particular quality is called a trade mark.

metadata.title_en: Property mark
metadata.text_en: A mark used for the purpose of indicating that some movable property belongs to a particular person is called a property mark.

metadata.title_en: Using a false trade mark
metadata.text_en: A person is said to use a false trade mark who uses a trade mark in any manner reasonably calculated to cause it to be believed that the goods so marked are the manufacture or merchandise of a person whose manufacture or merchandise they are not.

metadata.title_en: Using a false property mark
metadata.text_en: A person is said to use a false property mark who uses a property mark in any manner reasonably calculated to cause it to be believed that the property so marked belongs to a person to whom it does not belong.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for using a false trade mark or property mark
metadata.text_en: Whoever uses any false trade mark or property mark shall, unless he proves that he acted without intent to defraud, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Counterfeiting a trade mark or property mark used by another
metadata.text_en: Whoever counterfeits any trade mark or property mark used by any other person shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Counterfeiting a mark used by public servant
metadata.text_en: Whoever counterfeits any mark used by a public servant as such to denote that any property has been manufactured by a particular person or at a particular time or place, or that the property is of a particular quality or has passed a particular office, or that it is entitled to any allowance or rebate, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Having possession of any instrument for counterfeiting a trade mark or property mark, etc.
metadata.text_en: Whoever has in his possession any die, plate or other instrument for the purpose of counterfeiting a trade mark or property mark, or has in his possession any such counterfeit trade mark or property mark, knowing the same to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Selling goods marked with a counterfeit trade mark or property mark
metadata.text_en: Whoever sells, or exposes or has in possession for sale, any goods or things with a counterfeit trade mark or property mark, knowing the same to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Making a false mark upon any receptacle containing goods
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes any false mark upon any case, package or other receptacle containing goods, in a manner reasonably calculated to cause any person to believe that such receptacle contains goods which it does not contain, or that it contains goods of a nature or quality different from the real nature or quality thereof, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for making use of any such false mark
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes use of any such false mark as is described in section 487, in any manner reasonably calculated to cause any person to believe that the goods in connection with which such mark is used are of a nature or quality different from the real nature or quality thereof, shall be punished as if he had committed the offence described in section 487.

metadata.title_en: Tampering with property mark with intent to cause injury
metadata.text_en: Whoever, with intent to cause injury to any person, tampers with any property mark belonging to such person, or to another person, with intent thereby to defraud that person or another person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Counterfeiting currency-notes or bank-notes
metadata.text_en: Whoever counterfeits, or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting, any currency-note or bank-note, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Using as genuine forged or counterfeit currency-notes or bank-notes
