metadata.text_en: Whoever sells to, or purchases or receives from, any other person, or otherwise traffics in or uses as genuine, any forged or counterfeit currency-note or bank-note, knowing or having reason to believe the same to be forged or counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Possession of forged or counterfeit currency-notes or bank-notes
metadata.text_en: Whoever has in his possession any forged or counterfeit currency-note or bank-note, knowing or having reason to believe the same to be forged or counterfeit, and intending to use the same as genuine or that it may be used as genuine, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Making or possessing instruments or materials for counterfeiting currency-notes or bank-notes
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes, or performs any part of the process of making, or buys or sells or disposes of, or has in his possession, any instrument or material for the purpose of forging or counterfeiting any currency-note or bank-note, knowing or having reason to believe the same to be intended to be used for that purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Making or using documents resembling currency-notes or bank-notes
metadata.text_en:
(1) Whoever makes or causes to be made, or uses for any purpose whatever, or utters, or so deals with any document, being in form or appearance having a resemblance to a currency-note or bank-note, as to induce or be calculated to induce any person to believe that such document is a currency-note or bank-note, or otherwise to act to his prejudice, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred kyats, or with both.

(2) If any person whose name appears on a document, the making of which is an offence under sub-section (1), refuses, without reasonable excuse, to disclose to any police-officer on being so required the name and address of the person by whom it was printed or otherwise made, he shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred kyats, or with both.

(3) Where the name of any person appears on any document, the making of which is an offence under sub-section (1), or on any document used or circulated in connection with any such document, it shall, until the contrary is proved, be presumed that that person caused the document to be made or to be used or circulated, as the case may be.

metadata.title_en: Breach of contract of service during voyage or journey
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being bound by a lawful contract to render his personal service in a voyage or journey, or to supply the wants of any person during a voyage or journey, wilfully and knowingly disobeys such contract, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Breach of contract to attend on and supply wants of helpless person
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being bound by a lawful contract to attend on or to supply the wants of any person who, by reason of youth, or of unsoundness of mind or of a disease or bodily infirmity, is helpless, or incapable of providing for his own safety or of supplying his own wants, wilfully and knowingly omits so to do, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Breach of contract to serve at distant place to which servant is conveyed at master's expense
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being bound by a lawful contract to serve at any place to which he is conveyed at the expense of another, or with money advanced by another, wilfully and knowingly disobeys such contract, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Cohabitation caused by a man deceitfully inducing a belief of lawful marriage
metadata.text_en: Every man who by deceit causes any woman who is not lawfully married to him to believe that she is lawfully married to him and to cohabit or have sexual intercourse with him in that belief, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Marrying again during lifetime of husband or wife
metadata.text_en: Whoever, having a husband or wife living, marries in any case in which such marriage is void by reason of its taking place during the life of such husband or wife, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Same offence with concealment of former marriage from person with whom subsequent marriage is contracted
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits the offence defined in section 494, having concealed from the person with whom the subsequent marriage is contracted, the fact of the former marriage, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Same offence with concealment of former marriage from person with whom subsequent marriage is contracted
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits the offence defined in section 494, having concealed from the person with whom the subsequent marriage is contracted, the fact of the former marriage, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Marriage ceremony fraudulently gone through without lawful marriage
metadata.text_en: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently goes through any ceremony of marriage, knowing that he is not thereby lawfully married, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

metadata.title_en: Adultery
metadata.text_en: Whoever has sexual intercourse with a person who is and whom he knows or has reason to believe to be the wife of another man, without the consent or connivance of that man, such sexual intercourse not amounting to the offence of rape, is guilty of adultery, and shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both. In such case the wife shall not be punishable as an abettor.

metadata.title_en: Enticing or taking away or detaining with criminal intent a married woman
metadata.text_en: Whoever takes or entices away any woman who is and whom he knows or has reason to believe to be the wife of any other man, from that man, or from any person having the care of her on behalf of that man, with intent that she may have unlawful intercourse with any person, or conceals or detains with that intent any such woman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Defamation
metadata.text_en:
Whoever by words either spoken or intended to be read, or by signs or by visible representations, makes or publishes any imputation concerning any person intending to harm, or knowing or having reason to believe that such imputation will harm, the reputation of such person, is said, except in the cases hereinafter excepted, to defame that person.

Explanation 1.—It may amount to defamation to impute anything to a deceased person, if the imputation would harm the reputation of that person if living, and is intended to be hurtful to the feelings of his family or other near relatives.

Explanation 2.—It may amount to defamation to make an imputation concerning a company or an association or collection of persons as such.

Explanation 3.—An imputation in the form of an alternative or expressed ironically, may amount to defamation.

Explanation 4.—No imputation is said to harm a person's reputation unless that imputation directly or indirectly, in the estimation of others, lowers the moral or intellectual character of that person, or lowers the character of that person in respect of his caste or of his calling, or lowers the credit of that person, or causes it to be believed that the body of that person is in a loathsome state, or in a state generally considered as disgraceful.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for defamation
metadata.text_en: Whoever defames another shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Printing or engraving matter known to be defamatory
metadata.text_en: Whoever prints or engraves any matter, knowing or having good reason to believe that such matter is defamatory of any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Sale of printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter
metadata.text_en: Whoever sells or offers for sale any printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter, knowing that it contains such matter, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Criminal intimidation
metadata.text_en:
Whoever threatens another with any injury to his person, reputation or property, or to the person or reputation of any one in whom that person is interested, with intent to cause alarm to that person, or to cause that person to do any act which he is not legally bound to do, or to omit to do any act which he is legally entitled to do, as the means of avoiding the execution of such threat, commits criminal intimidation.

Explanation.—A threat to injure the reputation of any deceased person in whom the person threatened is interested is within this section.

metadata.title_en: Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace
metadata.text_en: Whoever intentionally insults, and thereby gives provocation to any person, intending or knowing it to be likely that such provocation will cause him to break the public peace, or to commit any other offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Statements conducing to public mischief
metadata.text_en:
Whoever makes, publishes or circulates any statement, rumour or report—

(a) with intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, any officer, soldier, sailor or airman in the Army, Navy or Air Force to mutiny or otherwise disregard or fail in his duty as such officer, soldier, sailor or airman; or

(b) with intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, fear or alarm to the public, or to any section of the public, whereby any person may be induced to commit an offence against the State or against the public tranquillity; or

(c) with intent to incite, or which is likely to incite, any class or community of persons to commit any offence against any other class or community of persons,

shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

Explanation.—It does not amount to an offence under this section when the person who makes, publishes or circulates any such statement, rumour or report, has reasonable grounds for believing, and does believe, that such statement, rumour or report is true and makes, publishes or circulates it without any such intent as aforesaid.

metadata.title_en: Statements, rumours or reports causing fear or alarm
metadata.text_en: Whoever makes, publishes or circulates any statement, rumour or report with intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, fear or alarm to the public, or to any section of the public, whereby any person may be induced to commit an offence against the State or against the public tranquillity, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Acts causing fear or alarm
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits any act with intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, fear or alarm to the public, or to any section of the public, whereby any person may be induced to commit an offence against the State or against the public tranquillity, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for criminal intimidation
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits the offence of criminal intimidation shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both; if the threat be to cause death or grievous hurt, or to cause the destruction of any property by fire, or to cause an offence punishable with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, or to impute unchastity to a woman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Criminal intimidation by anonymous communication
metadata.text_en: Whoever commits the offence of criminal intimidation by an anonymous communication, or having taken precautions to conceal the name or abode of the person from whom the threat comes, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, in addition to the punishment provided for the offence by the last preceding section.

metadata.title_en: Act caused by inducing person to believe that he will be rendered an object of divine displeasure
metadata.text_en: Whoever voluntarily causes or attempts to cause any person to do anything which that person is not legally bound to do, or to omit to do anything which he is legally entitled to do, by inducing or attempting to induce that person to believe that he or any person in whom he is interested will become or will be rendered by some act of the offender an object of divine displeasure if he does not do the thing which he is not legally bound to do or if he omits to do the thing which he is legally entitled to do, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman
metadata.text_en: Whoever, intending to insult the modesty of any woman, utters any word, makes any sound or gesture, or exhibits any object, intending that such word or sound shall be heard, or that such gesture or object shall be seen, by such woman, or intrudes upon the privacy of such woman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Misconduct in public by a drunken person
metadata.text_en: Whoever, in a state of intoxication, appears in any public place, or in any place which it is a trespass in him to enter, and there conducts himself in such a manner as to cause annoyance to any person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to twenty-four hours, or with fine which may extend to ten kyats, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Punishment for attempting to commit offences punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment
metadata.text_en: Whoever attempts to commit any offence punishable by this Code with imprisonment for life or imprisonment, or to cause such an offence to be committed, and in such attempt does any act towards the commission of the offence, shall, where no express provision is made by this Code for the punishment of such attempt, be punished with imprisonment of any description provided for the offence, for a term which may extend to one-half of the longest term of imprisonment provided for that offence, or with such fine as is provided for the offence, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Title
metadata.text_en: This law shall be known as the Cybersecurity Law.

metadata.title_en: Commencement
metadata.text_en: This law shall come into force on the date specified by the president by notification.

metadata.title_en: Jurisdiction
metadata.text_en: (a) Any person who commits any of the following offences punishable under this law shall be adjudicated according to this law: (1) Offences committed within the state or on board any vessel or aircraft registered under any law in force of the state; (2) offences committed within the national cyberspace or in any other cyberspace connected to the national cyberspace. (b) Any Myanmar citizen residing abroad who commits an offence punishable under this law shall be adjudicated according to this law.

metadata.title_en: Definitions
metadata.text_en: The following expressions shall have the meanings given hereunder:

metadata.title_en: Definition of "State"
metadata.text_en: "State" means the Republic of the Union of Myanmar;

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Central Committee"
metadata.text_en: "Central Committee" means the Cybersecurity Central Committee established by the Union Government under this law.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Steering Committee"
metadata.text_en: "Steering Committee" means the Cybersecurity Steering Committee formed by the Central Committee under this law.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Working Committee"
metadata.text_en: "Working Committee" means the Working Committee formed by the Steering Committee under this law.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Department"
metadata.text_en: "Department" means the Department of Cybersecurity established under this law.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Critical Information Infrastructure"
metadata.text_en: "Critical Information Infrastructure" means the information infrastructure and data that are vital for the security of the State, national defense, national economy, public health, public safety, and environment, and whose disruption or destruction would have a major impact on the country.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cybersecurity"
metadata.text_en: "Cybersecurity" means the protection of cyber sources and cyberspace from cyber-attacks and dangers, and the ability to continue to operate effectively and safely.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cyber source"
metadata.text_en: "Cyber source" means a computer, computer system, computer network, computer data, computer programme, or any other electronic device, equipment, system, or data that can be processed, stored, or transmitted electronically.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cyberspace"
metadata.text_en: "Cyberspace" means the complex environment resulting from the interaction of people, software, and services on the Internet and other electronic communication networks.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cyber-attack"
metadata.text_en: "Cyber-attack" means any action that threatens, damages, or disrupts cyber sources or cyberspace, including unauthorized access, data alteration, denial of service, and malware attacks.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Digital Platform"
metadata.text_en: "Digital Platform" means a platform that provides services through information technology and telecommunications technology, including social media platforms, e-commerce platforms, and other online service platforms.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Service provider"
metadata.text_en: "Service provider" means a person or organization that provides any service that relies on cyber sources or cyberspace, including internet service providers, telecommunications service providers, and digital platform providers.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Data"
metadata.text_en: "Data" means a representation of information, knowledge, facts, concepts, or instructions which are being prepared or have been prepared in a formalized manner, and is intended for use in a computer system or computer network.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Personal Data"
metadata.text_en: "Personal Data" means any data relating to an identified or identifiable natural person.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Sensitive Personal Data"
metadata.text_en: "Sensitive Personal Data" means personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, or trade union membership, and the processing of genetic data, biometric data for the purpose of uniquely identifying a natural person, data concerning health or data concerning a natural person’s sex life or sexual orientation.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Government Data"
metadata.text_en: "Government Data" means data owned or controlled by the government, including classified information and public data.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Traffic Data"
metadata.text_en: "Traffic Data" means any computer data related to a communication by means of a computer system that is generated by a computer system and shows its origin, destination, route, time, date, size, duration, or type of underlying service.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cybersecurity Incident"
metadata.text_en: "Cybersecurity Incident" means any event that has an actual or potential adverse effect on the cybersecurity of a cyber source or cyberspace.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cybercrime"
metadata.text_en: "Cybercrime" means any offence committed using a cyber source or cyberspace, or any offence relating to a cyber source or cyberspace.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "User"
metadata.text_en: "User" means any person who uses a cyber source or cyberspace.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "VPN (virtual private network)"
metadata.text_en: “VPN (virtual private network)” means a system that is set up as a separate network within the original network using specific technology to ensure security when connecting to a network.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Network equipment"
metadata.text_en: “Network equipment” means any item of physical infrastructure used in the execution of network operations, or a combination of such items.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Data analysis"
metadata.text_en: “Data analysis” means the process of gathering, analysing and examining any piece of information or part of it for the purpose of cybersecurity using cyber resources or similar technology and related equipment.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Malware"
metadata.text_en: “Malware” means a malicious code that disrupts or harms cyber resources.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cyberspace" (from user's input)
metadata.text_en: “Cyberspace” means an environment where electronic information can be sent, communicated, distributed or received, either within a network or between interconnected networks, using cyber resources or similar technology and related equipment.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cyberattack" (from user's input)
metadata.text_en: “Cyberattack” means any act that uses cyber resources or similar technology and related equipment in cyberspace to harm or damage the administration, finance, economy, law enforcement, national security and public safety of the state and life and property in the state, or to disrupt, distort, suspend or destroy the communication of information in any way.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cybercrime" (from user's input)
metadata.text_en: “Cybercrime” means the act of committing, attempting to commit, aiding and abetting, inciting, or acting as an accomplice to any offence under this law or any offence punishable under any law in force, using cyber resources or similar technology and related equipment in cyberspace.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cybersecurity threat"
metadata.text_en: “Cybersecurity threat” means any attempt to compromise cybersecurity using cyber resources or similar technology and related equipment in cyberspace.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Digital laboratory"
metadata.text_en: “Digital laboratory” means a technology-assisted laboratory that can identify, retrieve, process, analyse and report data stored electronically.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Online gambling system"
metadata.text_en: “Online gambling system” means a system that uses cyber resources or similar technology and related equipment to enable gambling (whether for a prize or not) in games of chance and games of skill for money, or for something that has monetary value or that has been agreed to be transferred as money.

metadata.title_en: Definition of "Cybersecurity group"
metadata.text_en: “Cybersecurity group” means a group that has been permitted by the Steering Committee as prescribed to carry out cybersecurity activities within the state without seeking profit.

metadata.title_en: Objectives of the Law
metadata.text_en: The objectives of this law are as follows: (a) Ensuring the safe and secure use of cyber resources, critical information infrastructure and electronic information; (b) protecting and safeguarding the sovereignty and stability of the state from cybersecurity threats, cyberattacks or cyber abuse using electronic technologies; (c) systematically developing cybersecurity services; (d) effectively investigating and prosecuting cybercrimes; (e) supporting a digital economy based on cyber resources.

metadata.title_en: Establishment of the Cybersecurity Central Committee
metadata.text_en: The Union Government: (a) Shall, to implement the objectives of this law, establish the Cybersecurity Central Committee with the Vice President as its chairperson, the Union minister of the Ministry as its vice chairperson, and Union ministers of relevant ministries and chairpersons of relevant Union-level organisations as its members. (b) Shall appoint and assign responsibilities to the secretary and joint secretary when establishing the Central Committee. (c) May, if necessary, reorganise the Central Committee according to the provisions of subsection (a).

metadata.title_en: Duties and Powers of the Central Committee
metadata.text_en: The duties and powers of the Central Committee are as follows: (a) Creating cybersecurity policies, strategies or action plans for the development of a sound and secure national cyberspace in the state; (b) providing guidance, supervision and coordination to implement cybersecurity policies, strategies or action plans, and to cooperate with countries in the region and elsewhere and with international and regional organisations; (c) promoting the development of human resources in cybersecurity; (d) promoting the development of infrastructure necessary for cybersecurity and cybercrime prevention; (e) providing coordination and guidance between relevant government departments and organisations to support cybersecurity, cybercrime prevention, law enforcement, and justice; (f) providing guidance to ensure that cybersecurity services for critical information infrastructures are coordinated according to the cybersecurity plan; (g) determining the storage of information for critical information infrastructure within the national cyber space to which the public connects; (h) permitting the establishment of a national digital laboratory and digital laboratories as prescribed; (i) providing guidance to the relevant ministry or organisation for the issuance, if necessary, of policies, regulations, terms, orders and directives for online financial services; (j) carrying out cybersecurity-related duties assigned by the Union Government from time to time.

metadata.title_en: Establishment of the Steering Committee
metadata.text_en: The Central Committee: (a) Shall, to carry out and supervise the cybersecurity activities under this law, establish the Steering Committee with the Union minister of the Ministry as chairperson, deputy ministers or permanent secretaries of relevant ministries, deputy chairpersons or permanent secretaries of relevant Union-level organisations, cybersecurity experts, and representatives of non-governmental organisations as members, and the director general of the Department as secretary. (b) May, if necessary, reorganise the Steering Committee according to the provisions of subsection (a). (c) allow members of the Steering Committee who are not civil servants to receive allowances and honoraria determined by the Union Government.

metadata.title_en: Duties and Powers of the Steering Committee
metadata.text_en: The duties and powers of the Steering Committee are as follows: (a) Implementing according to the guidelines the cybersecurity policies, strategies or action plans created by the Central Committee; (b) conducting human resource development activities related to cybersecurity; (c) taking steps to ensure that a timely response and protection system is in place in the event of a cyberattack; (d) coordinating with relevant ministries or organisations to ensure safety of the national cyberspace; (e) studying and submitting the matter to the Central Committee as to whether the state should participate as a member in conventions, treaties and agreements on cybersecurity or cybercrime. (f) implementing and cooperating according to conventions, treaties and agreements on cybersecurity or cybercrime in which the state participates as a member; (g) cooperating with international organisations, regional organisations and neighbouring countries in relation to information exchange, investigation, and action related to cybersecurity threats, cyberattacks, cyber abuse or cybercrimes; (h) publishing and announcing information on cybersecurity recommendations to raise public awareness, and reporting, announcing and preventing cyberattacks and cyber threats; (i) coordinating activities with the cybersecurity incident response teams to protect critical infrastructure; (j) inspecting, supervising and providing guidance on whether information on critical information infrastructure is stored as prescribed; (k) permitting the examination of cybersecurity groups, issuing terms that these groups must follow, and taking action against cybersecurity groups established without permission; (l) determining the license fees, registration fees, fines or other fees to be collected under this law; (m) establishing policies and standards regarding cyber resources that are manufactured in the country or abroad, installed, or imported from abroad; (n) when implementing this law, establishing an investigation team and determining its duties and powers with the consent of the Central Committee if an investigation is necessary; (o) submitting activity reports and other necessary reports to the Central Committee at least once a year; (p) carrying out cybersecurity-related duties assigned by the Central Committee from time to time.

metadata.title_en: Establishment of Working Committees
metadata.text_en: The Steering Committee may, with the consent of the Central Committee, establish and assign duties to the following working committees: (a) Cybersecurity Working Committee; (b) Cybercrime Working Committee; (c) Cyberdefence Working Committee;

metadata.title_en: Department as Secretariat
metadata.text_en: The Department shall be responsible for carrying out office functions as the secretariat team of the Central Committee and the Steering Committee.

metadata.title_en: Payment of Allowances and Honoraria by the Department
metadata.text_en: The Department shall pay the allowances and honoraria of the members of the Steering Committee who are not civil servants.

metadata.title_en: Duties and Powers of the Department
metadata.text_en: The Department: (a) May, when implementing international and regional cybersecurity cooperation initiatives, communicate, coordinate and cooperate with international cybersecurity organisations and regional cybersecurity organisations according to the Ministry's guidelines. (b) May conduct competency tests or competitions in cybersecurity technology and skills according to international standards and issue certificates. (c) Shall sector-wise implement cybersecurity cooperation activities within the state in accordance with the Ministry’s guidelines. (d) Shall, with the approval of the Ministry, determine the terms for licensing cybersecurity services and the terms for registering digital platform services. (e) Shall collect as prescribed the license fees, registration fees, fines or other fees to be collected according to this law. (f) Shall be responsible for implementing the cybersecurity policies, strategies, action plans and guidelines created by the Central Committee.

metadata.title_en: Critical Information Infrastructures
metadata.text_en: The following infrastructures are considered to be critical information infrastructures: (a) Electronic information infrastructure for national defence and security; (b) infrastructure for the electronic government (e-Government) service system; (c) electronic information infrastructure for finance; (d) electronic information infrastructure for transportation; (e) electronic information infrastructure for telecommunication; (f) electronic information infrastructure for health; (g) electronic information infrastructure for electricity and energy; (h) electronic information infrastructure as determined from time to time by the Central Committee with the consent of the Union Government.

metadata.title_en: Identification and Maintenance of Critical Information Infrastructures
metadata.text_en: The Central Committee shall direct the relevant government departments and government organisations to identify, modify and maintain critical information infrastructures.

metadata.title_en: Duties of Government Departments and Organisations Regarding Critical Information Infrastructure
metadata.text_en: Relevant government departments and organisations shall act as follows with regard to critical information infrastructure: (a) Developing cybersecurity plans as prescribed; (b) establishing cybersecurity incident response teams; (c) appointing a suitable person as person responsible for the management and maintenance of critical information infrastructure; (d) submitting a cybersecurity report to the Steering Committee at least once per calendar year.

metadata.title_en: Responsibilities of the Person Responsible for Critical Information Infrastructure
metadata.text_en: The person responsible for the management and maintenance of critical information infrastructure: (a) Shall store as prescribed information related to critical information infrastructure based on the level [of classification] of the data. (b) Shall distribute, publish, send, receive and store information related to critical information infrastructure as prescribed. (c) Shall submit a cybersecurity report on the critical information infrastructure to the Ministry through the relevant government department or government organisation at least once per calendar year.

metadata.title_en: Supervision of Cybersecurity Readiness Measures
metadata.text_en: Supervised by the Steering Committee, the Ministry shall supervise and inspect whether the person responsible for the management and maintenance of critical information infrastructure has carried out cybersecurity readiness measures as prescribed.

metadata.title_en: License and Registration Terms
metadata.text_en: The Department may set the cybersecurity service license term and the digital platform registration term from a minimum of 3 years to a maximum of 10 years.

metadata.title_en: Cybersecurity Service Provider Registration
metadata.text_en: A cybersecurity service provider must be a company registered according to the Myanmar Companies Law and shall apply to the Department as prescribed to obtain a business license.

metadata.title_en: Review and Approval of Cybersecurity Service License Applications
metadata.text_en: The Department shall review the application filed according to section 20 as to whether it is as prescribed and act as follows: (a) Shall cause the applicant to pay the license fee and issue the license if the application is as prescribed. (b) Shall request the applicant to amend the application or reject the issuance of the license if the application is not as prescribed.

metadata.title_en: License Renewal for Cybersecurity Service Providers
metadata.text_en: If a cybersecurity service provider wishes to continue operating, it must apply as prescribed to the Department for license renewal 6 months prior to the expiration of the license.

metadata.title_en: Review of License Renewal Applications
metadata.text_en: The Department: (a) May review whether the application for license renewal is as prescribed and approve or reject it. (b) If the Department rejects the renewal of the license, such rejection shall not affect the remaining term of the license.

metadata.title_en: Digital Platform Service Provider Registration
metadata.text_en: A digital platform service provider with 100,000 or more users within the state must be a company registered in accordance with the Myanmar Companies Law and shall apply as prescribed to the Department to be allowed registration.

metadata.title_en: Review and Approval of Digital Platform Service Registration Applications
metadata.text_en: The Department shall review the application filed according to section 24 as to whether it is as prescribed and act as follows: (a) Shall cause the applicant to pay the registration fee and issue a registration certificate if the application is as prescribed. (b) Shall request the applicant to amend the application or reject the issuance of a registration certificate if the application is not as prescribed.

metadata.title_en: Registration Renewal for Digital Platform Service Providers
metadata.text_en: If a digital platform service provider wishes to continue operating, it must apply as prescribed to the Department for renewal of the registration period 6 months prior to the expiration of the registration period.

metadata.title_en: Review of Registration Renewal Applications
metadata.text_en: The Department: (a) May review whether the application for renewal of the registration is as prescribed and approve or reject it. (b) If the Department rejects the renewal of the registration, such rejection shall not affect the remaining term of the registration.

metadata.title_en: Permission for Cybersecurity Groups
metadata.text_en: A cybersecurity group shall obtain permission as prescribed from the Central Committee to carry out cybersecurity activities within the state without seeking profit.

metadata.title_en: Duties of a Cybersecurity Service Provider
metadata.text_en: A cybersecurity service provider shall comply with the following: (a) Obtaining necessary permits or documentation according to relevant laws for the business or sector in which the cybersecurity service provider wishes to be active; (b) establishing and implementing cybersecurity prevention plans to assist the Department and the cybersecurity incident response teams; (c) advising on potential cybersecurity threats and preventive measures; (d) developing emergency response plans and solutions for malware or cyberattacks; (e) in the event of a malware or cyberattack, promptly implementing an appropriate emergency response plan, addressing and resolving [the issue], and notifying the relevant stakeholders; (f) applying cybersecurity technology and necessary international standards; (g) preventing leakage, damage to, or loss of information of users accessing the service; (h) immediately notifying the Department if an exceptional cybersecurity incident occurs; (i) complying with the terms of the license; (j) compiling and submitting a cybersecurity activity report to the Department as prescribed.

metadata.title_en: Duties of a Digital Platform Service Provider
metadata.text_en: A digital platform service provider shall comply with the following: (a) Obtaining necessary permits or documentation according to relevant laws for the business or sector in which the digital platform service provider wishes to be active; (b) maintaining the data storage device as prescribed depending on the level [of classification] of the data of the user accessing the service; (c) If the digital platform service provider wishes to conduct any related business or profit-generating business through the digital platform service, it shall do so according to the relevant laws. (d) complying with the terms in the registration certificate.

metadata.title_en: Measures for Identifying Information and Cyber Resources on Service Platforms
metadata.text_en: A digital platform service provider shall have adequate measures in place to identify the relevant information and cyber resource in the event that any of the following occurs on the service platform: (a) Information occurs that incites hatred, disrupts unity, or disrupts peace and order; (b) false news or rumors occur; (c) information is displayed that is not suitable for public viewing; (d) display of pornographic pictures, pornographic videos, texts or symbols of children that are sexually explicit; (e) display of information that is contrary to any law in force, or performance of an illegal act; (f) a complaint occurs regarding information intended to cause social or economic harm to an individual; (g) a complaint occurs regarding the infringement of an intellectual property right; (h) inciting to commit, committing, attempting, and aiding or abetting acts of terrorism.

metadata.title_en: Response to Prohibited Acts on Digital Platforms
metadata.text_en: If a digital platform service provider becomes aware in any way that any of the acts set forth in section 31 occurred or is notified to this effect by the Department, it must prevent, remove, destroy or suspend the act in a timely manner as prescribed.

metadata.title_en: Data Retention by Digital Platform Service Providers
metadata.text_en: A digital platform service provider shall retain the following data regarding a user of the service for 3 years: (a) Personal information of the user accessing the service; (b) usage records of the user accessing the service; (c) data specified by the Department from time to time.

metadata.title_en: Provision of User Data to Authorized Entities
metadata.text_en: If an individual or organisation authorised under any law in force requests in writing any or all of the data in section 33, the digital platform service provider shall provide it as prescribed.

metadata.title_en: Cooperation with Working Committees
metadata.text_en: A cybersecurity service provider or digital platform service provider shall cooperate with the relevant working committee in dealing with any cybersecurity threat, cyberattack or cyber abuse incident.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Cyber Abuse
metadata.text_en: Unless otherwise provided in any law in force, any of the following acts, done without permission from the authorised person, to harm a cyber resource or the performance of a computer system is considered cyber abuse: (a) Altering, modifying or deleting with dishonest intention any computer programme or programme or information, or its condition or quality; (b) selling a computer programme or programme or information, or moving, transferring or copying it with dishonest intention from its original location to another location, to another cyber resource or to any storage device; (c) obtaining, operating or using with dishonest intention a computer programme or programme or electronic information; (d) modifying, adding to, destroying or altering a computer programme or programme or electronic information, or impairing its performance, or altering its original state in any way; (e) controlling or remotely controlling a computer system, computer programme or programme or electronic information; (f) analysing with dishonest intention data from a computer programme or programme or information.

metadata.title_en: Duties of Working Committees
metadata.text_en: The working committees established by the Steering Committee according to this law shall, under the supervision of the Steering Committee, do the following: (a) Preventing cybersecurity threats, cyberattacks or cyber abuse from occurring; (b) assisting relevant law enforcement groups in investigating cybercrimes and assessing the risk of cybercrimes; (c) taking preventive measures to avoid potential secondary risks from cybersecurity threats, cyberattacks or cyber abuse; (d) assessing the likelihood of a cybersecurity threat, cyberattack or cyber abuse incident occurring and the potential impact if it occurs; (e) monitoring and evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of cybersecurity levels in relevant sectors and making recommendations to relevant government departments and organisations to improve cybersecurity; (f) identifying, investigating and taking action against cybersecurity threats, cyberattacks or cyber abuse; (g) evaluating the services of cybersecurity service providers or digital platform service providers; (h) providing technical assistance to the national digital laboratory and digital laboratories.

metadata.title_en: Seizure and Analysis of Cyber Resources by Working Committees
metadata.text_en: The relevant working committee may as prescribed seize and analyse cyber resources from any of the following persons who are believed to be implicated in any cybersecurity threat, cyberattack or cyber abuse incident: (a) a person who has used or is suspected of having used a cyber resource that is believed to be implied in a cyber security threat, cyberattack or cyber abuse incident; (b) a person associated with any person in sub-section (a).

metadata.title_en: Return of Seized Cyber Resources
metadata.text_en: The relevant working committee shall, after it has analysed the data in the cyber resource and dispatched the cyber resource to a digital laboratory for examination, return the cyber resource as prescribed to the person who provided it.

metadata.title_en: Data Analysis for Cybersecurity Threats
metadata.text_en: The Ministry may, with the consent of the Union Government, assign a relevant person or organisation for conducting data analyses and dispatches to a digital laboratory for examination, to identify in advance cyber security threats or cyberattacks in the national cyberspace so that they may be prevented and controlled.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Support for Data Analysis in Telecommunications
metadata.text_en: The Ministry shall provide support as necessary to companies and organisations providing telecommunications services according to the Telecommunications Law for conducting data analyses and dispatches to a digital laboratory for examination according to section 40.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Authority to Inspect and Control Cybersecurity and Digital Platform Services
metadata.text_en: The Ministry may, for national defense and security matters, in the interest of the public, or in consultation with the relevant government department or government organisation pursuant to any law, enter cyber security service businesses or digital platform service businesses to inspect and control them, if necessary.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Authority Regarding Digital Platform Services
metadata.text_en: The Ministry may, with the consent of the Union Government, do the following if necessary for the public interest: (a) Temporarily suspending digital platform services or electronic information; (b) temporarily controlling materials related to digital platform services; (c) closing digital platform services or declaring them unfit for public use.

metadata.title_en: VPN Permission Requirement
metadata.text_en: Anyone wishing to establish a VPN or provide VPN services within the national cyberspace shall obtain permission as prescribed from the Ministry.

metadata.title_en: Seizure of Electronic Evidence by Investigation Team
metadata.text_en: The investigation team may seize as prescribed electronic evidence according to the provisions of this law and any law in force to investigate cybersecurity or cybercrime matters.

metadata.title_en: Seizure and Analysis of Cyber Resources in Cybercrime Investigation
metadata.text_en: When investigating a cybercrime, the investigation team may seize as prescribed cyber resources or similar technology and related equipment that are believed to be related to the matter under investigation, and conduct data analyses and dispatches to a digital laboratory for examination.

metadata.title_en: Establishment of National Digital Laboratories
metadata.text_en: The relevant government department or government organisation may, with the approval of the Central Committee, establish a national digital laboratory or digital laboratories to identify, obtain, process, analyse and report according to the provisions of this law and any law in force on electronic evidence stored electronically.

metadata.title_en: Support for Digital Laboratories
metadata.text_en: The Steering Committee shall assist in providing the necessary human resources and technical assistance for the national digital laboratory and the digital laboratories established with the approval of the Central Committee.

metadata.title_en: Electronic Evidence Submission and Reporting
metadata.text_en: The investigation team may send electronic evidence stored electronically to the national digital laboratory or a digital laboratory for data discovery, gathering, management and analysis, and submit as prescribed the resulting findings, report and opinion to the Steering Committee or relevant court as expert testimony.

metadata.title_en: Disputes Regarding Electronic Evidence
metadata.text_en: (a) If any dispute arises regarding the submission of evidence as an electronic document, the matter shall be sent to the national digital laboratory for examination. (b) The national digital laboratory’s report and opinion on the result of the examination shall be final.

metadata.title_en: Administrative Orders for Cybersecurity Service Providers
metadata.text_en: The Department may impose any of the following administrative orders on a cyber security service provider who fails to comply with any provision of section 29 or 35: (a) Warning; (b) imposition of a fine; (c) temporary suspension of the license for a limited period; (d) revocation of the license.

metadata.title_en: Administrative Orders for Digital Platform Service Providers
metadata.text_en: The Department may impose any of the following administrative orders on a digital platform service provider who fails to comply with any provision of section 30, 31, 32, 33, 34 or 35: (a) Warning; (b) imposition of a fine; (c) temporary suspension of the registration certificate for a limited period; (d) revocation of the registration certificate and blacklisting.

metadata.title_en: Dissolution and Confiscation for Cybersecurity Groups
metadata.text_en: The Steering Committee may dissolve a cybersecurity group that was established without permission or that does not comply with the terms, and may confiscate the funds of the group, including the money and movable or immovable property owned by the group, as property of the state.

metadata.title_en: Appeal to Ministry for License/Registration Rejection
metadata.text_en: Any person dissatisfied with the Department’s rejection to issue a license according to section 21, rejection to renew a license according to section 23, rejection to register according to section 25 or rejection to renew a registration according to section 27 may appeal to the Ministry as prescribed within 30 days from the date on which such decision or order was made.

metadata.title_en: Appeal to Ministry for Administrative Actions
metadata.text_en: Any person dissatisfied with any administrative action taken according to section 51 or 52 may appeal to the Ministry as prescribed within 30 days from the date on which such decision or order was made.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Decision on Appeals
metadata.text_en: The Ministry may confirm, modify or cancel the relevant decision or order in relation to an appeal according to section 54 or 55.

metadata.title_en: Appeal to Central Committee
metadata.text_en: Any person dissatisfied with a decision or order made by the Ministry according to section 56 may appeal to the Central Committee as prescribed within 60 days from the date on which such decision or order was made.

metadata.title_en: Central Committee's Decision on Appeals
metadata.text_en: The Central Committee may confirm, modify or cancel the relevant decision or order in relation to an appeal according to section 57.

metadata.title_en: Finality of Central Committee's Decision
metadata.text_en: The decision of the Central Committee is final and conclusive.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Non-Compliance by Critical Information Infrastructure Responsible Person (Non-Civil Servant)
metadata.text_en: If a person responsible for the management and maintenance of critical information infrastructure, who is not a civil servant, is convicted of having failed to comply with the provisions of section 17 (a) or (b), he shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 1 month but not more than 6 months, or with a fine of not less than MMK 1,000,000 but not more than MMK 10,000,000, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Unauthorized Interference with Critical Information Infrastructure
metadata.text_en: Any person convicted of having committed or attempted to commit an act of unauthorised interference, destruction, theft, damage, unlawful transmission, use, distribution, disclosure, modification or alteration of electronic information pertaining to a critical information infrastructure shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 6 months but not more than 3 years, or with a fine of not less than MMK 5,000,000 but not more than MMK 20,000,000, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Providing Cybersecurity Services Without a License
metadata.text_en: If any person is convicted of having provided cyber security services without a license: (a) Such person shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 1 month but not more than 6 months, or with a fine of not less than MMK 1,000,000 but not more than one MMK 10,000,000, or with both, and the evidence relating to the case shall be confiscated as property of the state. (b) If the offender is a company or organisation, such company or organisation shall be punished with a fine of not less than MMK 10,000,000, and the evidence relating to the case shall be confiscated as property of the state.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Continuing Cybersecurity Services Without License Renewal
metadata.text_en: Any person convicted of having continued to provide cybersecurity services without renewing his license shall be punished with a fine of not less than MMK 1,000,000 and not more than MMK 5,000,000.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Operating Digital Platform Services Without Registration
metadata.text_en: If a person operating digital platform services with 100,000 or more users in the state is convicted of having operated without registration, he shall be punished with a fine of at least MMK 100,000,000, and the evidence related to the case shall be confiscated as property of the state.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Continuing Digital Platform Services Without Registration Renewal
metadata.text_en: Any person convicted of having continued to operate digital platform services without renewing his registration shall be punished with a fine of not less than MMK 50,000,000.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Certain Cyber-Abuse Offenses (Section 36 a, b, c, d)
metadata.text_en: Any person convicted of any of the cyber-abuse offences in section 36 (a), (b), (c) or (d) shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 6 months but not exceeding 2 years, or with a fine of not less than MMK 1,000,000 but not more than MMK 10,000,000, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Certain Cyber-Abuse Offenses (Section 36 e, f)
metadata.text_en: Any person convicted of any of the cyber-abuse offences in section 36 (e) or (f) shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 1 year but not more than 3 years, or with a fine of not less than MMK 5,000,000 but not more than MMK 20,000,000, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Dishonest Acts using Cyber Resources
metadata.text_en: Any person convicted of having with dishonest intention committed or having with dishonest intention caused another person to commit any of the following acts shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 1 year and not more than 2 years, or with a fine of not less than MMK 5,000,000 and not more than MMK 20,000,000, or with both: (a) Performing acts that may damage cyber resources or install malware or cause malware to enter; (b) preventing a person authorised to access a cyber resource from accessing the system; (c) destroying, removing, altering or otherwise impairing the usefulness or effectiveness of information contained in a cyber resource; (d) stealing, disabling, destroying or altering source code on a computer with the intent of damaging it; (e) cheating using cyber resources; (f) electronically creating, modifying or altering information to harm another person or degrade his reputation, or electronically distributing such data; (g) using a network to send unwanted or unsolicited text messages, e-mails or information.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Cyber-Theft/Destruction of Online Financial Assets
metadata.text_en: Any person convicted of having with dishonest intention used a cyber resource to steal or destroy any online financial assets of another person, or having with dishonest intention caused another person to do so, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 2 years and not more than 7 years, and may also be fined.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Unauthorized VPN Services
metadata.text_en: If any person is convicted of having established a VPN or having provided VPN services without permission from the Ministry: (a) Such person shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 1 month but not more than 6 months, or with a fine of not less than MMK 1,000,000 but not more than MMK 10,000,000, or with both, and the evidence relating to the case shall be confiscated as property of the state. (b) If the offender is a company or organisation, such company or organisation shall be punished with a fine of not less than MMK 10,000,000, and the evidence relating to the case shall be confiscated as property of the state.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Unauthorized Online Gambling Systems
metadata.text_en: If any person is convicted of having established an online gambling system without permission: (a) Such person shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 6 months but not more than 1 year, or with a fine of not less than MMK 5,000,000 but not more than MMK 20,000,000, or with both, and the property related to the case shall be confiscated as property of the state. (b) If the offender is a company or organisation, such company or organisation shall be punished with a fine of not less than MMK 20,000,000, and the evidence relating to the case shall be confiscated as property of the state.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Electronic Distribution of Inappropriate Information
metadata.text_en: Any person convicted of having electronically distributed, transmitted, sent, copied or sold information that is not suitable to be viewed by the public shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 1 month but not more than 6 months, or with a fine of not less than MMK 1,000,000 but not more than MMK 10,000,000, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Violating Rules, Regulations, etc. under the Law
metadata.text_en: If any person is convicted of having violated any of the rules, regulations, terms, notifications, orders, directives and procedures issued under this law: (a) Such person shall be punished with imprisonment for a term of not less than 1 month but not more than 3 months, or with a fine of not less than MMK 1,000,000 but not more than MMK 10,000, or with both, and the evidence relating to the case shall be confiscated as property of the state. (b) If the offender is a company or organisation, such company or organisation shall be punished with a fine of not less than MMK 10,000,000, and the evidence relating to the case shall be confiscated as property of the state.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Attempt, Conspiracy, Aid, and Abetment
metadata.text_en: Any person convicted of having attempted or conspired to commit any offence under this law, or of having aided and abetted in the commission of an offence under this law shall be subject to the punishment prescribed for that offense under this law.

metadata.title_en: Submission of Evidence when Production is Difficult
metadata.text_en: If the evidence relating to an offence prosecuted under this law is difficult to produce before the court, the investigation team may submit to the relevant court a report and documentary evidence on how the evidence has been preserved. Such submission shall be treated as if the evidence had been produced before the court and may be handled by the relevant court according to the law.

metadata.title_en: Permission for Existing Cybersecurity Groups
metadata.text_en: A cybersecurity group established before this law came into force shall obtain permission within 6 months from the date on which this law comes into force.

metadata.title_en: Collection of Fees and Fines
metadata.text_en: The Department shall collect the fees and fines due under this law as prescribed as if they were tax arrears.

metadata.title_en: International Cooperation and Extradition
metadata.text_en: (a) If international cooperation is required in matters under this law, this shall be done according to the Mutual Assistance in Criminal Matters Law. (b) If the perpetrator of an offense under this law is a foreigner who committed it abroad, the Extradition Law shall be complied with.

metadata.title_en: Action Against Civil Servants for Non-Compliance
metadata.text_en: If the person responsible for the management and maintenance of critical information infrastructure is a civil servant, and it is found that he has failed to comply with section 17 (a) or (b), action shall be taken against him according to the Civil Services Personnel Law.

metadata.title_en: Steering Committee, Working Committee, and Investigation Team Members as Public Servants
metadata.text_en: Any member of the Steering Committee or a working committee or an investigation team who is not a civil servant shall, while performing duties under this law, be deemed to be a public servant according to section 21 Penal Code.

metadata.title_en: Protection from Prosecution for Good Faith Actions
metadata.text_en: No person or organisation having been assigned responsibilities and duties to act under this law shall be prosecuted for acting in good faith.

metadata.title_en: Prior Permission for Prosecution
metadata.text_en: Prior permission from the Ministry shall be obtained for prosecution under this law.

metadata.title_en: Exclusive Prosecution Under This Law
metadata.text_en: The commission of offences under this law shall be prosecuted under this law only.

metadata.title_en: Cognizable Offences
metadata.text_en: Offences under sections 60, 62, 64, 66, 68, 71 and 72 are cognizable offences.

metadata.title_en: Liability for Public Losses
metadata.text_en: Administrative action or criminal prosecution under this law shall not be deemed to relieve the person subject to the administrative action or the offender from his liability if he is liable to make good for public losses arising from the matter.

metadata.title_en: Exemptions by Central Committee or Steering Committee
metadata.text_en: The Central Committee or the Steering Committee: (a) May, with the consent of the Union Government, exempt for the public benefit any government department, government organisation or individual from a permission, license or registration and from the payment of fees that would otherwise be compulsory according to this law. (b) May, in cases related to a national emergency, to national defense and security or to a natural disaster, act on its own, and without the prior consent of the Union Government grant an exemption from a permission or license and from the payment of fees that would otherwise be compulsory according to this law. (c) Shall report back to the Union Government the matters according to subsection (b).

metadata.title_en: Clarification of Technical Expressions
metadata.text_en: If the Ministry needs to clarify the meaning of any technical expression or specialised expression in this law, it may, with the approval of the Central Committee, issue a notification to provide such clarification.

metadata.title_en: Implementation of Law Provisions
metadata.text_en: When implementing the provisions of this law: (a) The Ministry may issue rules, regulations and terms with the approval of the Union Government. (b) The Central Committee, the Steering Committee, the working committees and the Department may issue notifications, orders, directives and procedures.

metadata.title_en: Short Title and Commencement
metadata.text_en:
(a) This law shall be called the People’s Military Service Law.
(b) This law shall come into force on the date specified by order of the Chairman of the State Peace and Development Council.

metadata.title_en: Definitions
metadata.text_en:
In this Law, the following expressions shall have the meanings given below:
(a) **'Citizen who serves in the military'** means a citizen serving in the military under this Law.
(b) **'Any person liable for military service'** means any male citizen who has attained 18 years of age and has not yet attained 35 years of age; and any female citizen who has attained 18 years of age and has not yet attained 27 years of age; and any male citizen who is a specialist, who has attained 18 years of age and has not yet attained 45 years of age; and any female citizen who is a specialist, who has attained 18 years of age and has not yet attained 35 years of age.
(c) **'Industrial and technical expert'** means a person possessing industrial and technical expertise who is not included in the official gazette specified by the order of the relevant department, among the staff currently serving in government departments.
(d) **'Expert'** means a person whose livelihood is dependent on a profession such as a doctor, engineer, industrial and technical expert, or any other profession.
(e) **'Family member'** means mother, father or husband, wife, children, siblings.
(f) **'Religious servant'** means the following:
(1) For the Buddhist faith, monks, novices, and nuns who are members of the Sangha and hold a Sangha identity card, continuously serving in the monastic order.
(2) For the Christian faith, a person who has dedicated himself primarily to serving in the ministry and is recognized and certified by the relevant major Christian churches.
(3) For the Hindu faith, a Sanyasi, Mahant, or Hindu Head Priest.
(g) **'Person attending an educational institution'** means a person who is studying in a university, college, institute, or school established or recognized by the government.

metadata.title_en: Duration of People's Military Service
metadata.text_en:
The duration for people to serve in the military is stipulated as follows:
(a) Any citizen within the age range for military service may be called to serve for a period not exceeding (24) months.
(b) Among citizens within the age range for military service, those called to serve as military industrial and technical personnel may be called to serve for a period not exceeding (36) months.
(c) Experts within the age range for military service may be called to serve for a period not exceeding (36) months.

metadata.title_en: Extension of Service Period in Emergency
metadata.text_en: If a national emergency occurs, the Government may extend the period of people's military service up to (5) years.

metadata.title_en: Exclusion of Certain Periods from Service Calculation
metadata.text_en: The period of a People's Military Service shall not include the period of punishment imposed by a court-martial or other means under the 1959 Defence Services Act while serving in the military, nor the period of punishment imposed by a court-martial or civil court for a military offense.

metadata.title_en: Formation of Central Body for People's Military Service
metadata.text_en: The Government or an organization delegated authority by it shall form the Central Body for People's Military Service.

metadata.title_en: Functions of the Central Body for People's Military Service
metadata.text_en:
The Central Body for People's Military Service shall:
(a) Form the People's Military Service Region or State Bodies, District Bodies, and Township Bodies as necessary.
(b) Conduct the medical examination of those called for People's Military Service with the Defence Services Medical Examination Boards.

metadata.title_en: Village or Ward Peace and Development Council's Responsibility
metadata.text_en: The Village or Ward Peace and Development Council shall, by December 31st of each year, compile a list of citizens residing in their Village or Ward who are within the age range for military service and submit it to the People's Military Service Township Body by January 1st of the following year, in accordance with the prescribed specifications.

metadata.title_en: Responsibilities of the People's Military Service Township Body
metadata.text_en:
The People's Military Service Township Body shall:
(a) Call and register every citizen within the age range for military service. A registration certificate shall be issued for such registration.
(b) Call for medical examination those within the age range for military service who possess a registration certificate.

metadata.title_en: Reporting for Service and Delivery of Call-up Order
metadata.text_en:
(a) A person called for People's Military Service by the People's Military Service Township Body shall report to the military unit or department specified in the call-up order within the stipulated period without fail.
(b) A call-up order issued to an individual within the age range for military service for any matter related to this Law shall be delivered to the relevant person. If the person cannot be found, it shall be handed over to any family member residing at the same address in the presence of a witness. Such a call-up order shall be deemed to have been directly delivered to the person liable for military service.

metadata.title_en: Compliance with 1959 Defence Services Act
metadata.text_en: A citizen shall comply with the 1959 Defence Services Act from the date he is accepted as a People's Military Service member.

metadata.title_en: Review of Exemptions and Deferrals by Township Body
metadata.text_en:
The People's Military Service Township Body shall:
(a) When a person called for military service submits an appeal stating reasons for exemption from military service, for a shorter period of service, or for deferral for a specific period, investigate the following matters:
(1) Whether the personal information is correct and accurate.
(2) Whether the stated reasons are correct and reliable.
(3) Whether supporting documents and testimonials are completely and properly submitted.
(b) If the appeal lacks complete personal information, or if supporting documents, evidence, and testimonials are not fully or properly submitted, the Township Body shall request these from the appellant.
(c) After completing the procedures under subsections (a) and (b), the Township Body shall submit the appeal of the person called, along with the findings of the Defence Services Medical Examination Board, its own investigation findings, and its remarks, to the People's Military Service District Body.
(d) Compile a list of those within the township who meet the qualifications for military service and submit it to the higher authority as required.

metadata.title_en: District Body's Review and Submission
metadata.text_en: The People's Military Service District Body shall, with its remarks, further submit the appeals presented by the People's Military Service Township Body to the People's Military Service Region or State Body.

metadata.title_en: Region/State Body's Review and Submission
metadata.text_en: The People's Military Service Region or State Body shall, with its remarks, further submit the appeals presented by the People's Military Service District Body to the People's Military Service Central Body.

metadata.title_en: Exemption and Deferral by Central Body
metadata.text_en:
(a) The People's Military Service Central Body, upon scrutinizing the appeals of those called for service submitted by the People's Military Service Region or State Body, may temporarily defer persons who fall under the following categories from the duty of serving in the People's Military Service:
(1) Those who have a recommendation from the relevant Defence Services Medical Examination Board stating that they are not medically fit to temporarily serve in the military.
(2) Government employees.
(3) Students.
(4) Those who are caring for family members who have no other caregivers.
(5) Those who are undergoing medical treatment for drug addiction.
(6) Those who are serving a prison sentence.
(b) Persons under subsection (a) shall serve the prescribed period of People's Military Service so as to complete it, if the period of temporary deferment granted to them does not exceed their military service age.

metadata.title_en: Entitlements of People's Military Service Members
metadata.text_en: A People's Military Service member shall be entitled to rations and allowances in accordance with the rank specified in the Tatmadaw (Armed Forces) while serving in the military.

metadata.title_en: Compensation for Death or Injury During Service
metadata.text_en: If a People's Military Service member dies or is injured during the period of military service, and it is related to the performance of duty, they shall be entitled to the benefits specified in the Tatmadaw (Armed Forces).

metadata.title_en: Employment Status of Civil Servants and Workers after Service
metadata.text_en:
(a) For a civil servant serving as a People's Military Service member, the period of service shall be considered as a period of duty.
(b) An employer shall re-employ a worker who has completed the People's Military Service period under sections 3 and 4 in their previous employment or an equivalent position as prescribed.

metadata.title_en: Voluntary Enlistment after Service
metadata.text_en: A person who has completed the People's Military Service for the period specified in section 3 may, if they wish to join the Tatmadaw (Armed Forces) and serve, be permitted to do so in accordance with the prescribed rules and regulations.

metadata.title_en: Appointment of Reserve Officers in Emergency
metadata.text_en: Graduates, professionals, and others who meet the prescribed qualifications may be appointed as reserve officers in an emergency.

metadata.title_en: Mobilization for National Defense and Security
metadata.text_en:
(a) If an emergency arises in some parts of the country or throughout the country for national defense and security, the Union Government may issue an order for the mobilization of all or some citizens within the age range for military service, or all or some who have completed People's Military Service, to be assembled at a suitable location.
(b) Those called under the order in subsection (a) shall report to the relevant call-up bodies within the stipulated period. They shall proceed to the military units or departments assigned by the call-up bodies and serve in the military.
(c) The People's Military Service Central Body may direct a called citizen to continue serving in their current occupation based on operational requirements and their capabilities.

metadata.title_en: Exemptions from People's Military Service
metadata.text_en:
The following persons shall be exempt from the duty of People's Military Service:
(a) Religious servants.
(b) Married women (including women who are married and have children).
(c) Permanently disabled persons with a permanent physical disability.
(d) Those whom the Defence Services Medical Examination Board has determined to be permanently unfit for People's Military Service.
(e) Those who have been granted exemption by order of the People's Military Service Central Body.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Non-Compliance
metadata.text_en:
Whoever is convicted of any of the following acts or omissions without reasonable excuse shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years, or with a fine, or with both:
(a) Failing to report for registration when called by the People's Military Service Township Body under section 9, subsection (a).
(b) Failing to report for medical examination when called by the People's Military Service Township Body under section 9, subsection (b).
(c) Even if medically cleared, failing to report when called by the People's Military Service Township Body for People's Military Service under section 10.
(d) Failing to report to the military unit or department specifically assigned to them when an order for mobilization is issued under section 21, subsection (b).
(e) Providing false information in connection with any matter to be declared under this Law.
(f) Failing to re-employ a worker who has completed their People's Military Service period under section 18, subsection (b).

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Evading Military Service
metadata.text_en:
Whoever is convicted of committing any of the following offenses with the intent to evade military service shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years, or with a fine, or with both:
(a) Falsely simulating illness with the intent to lower their health standard.
(b) Falsely pretending to be disabled.
(c) Causing self-inflicted illness or disability.
(d) Intentionally delaying or aggravating their illness or disability, or doing so to cause it to recur.
(e) Willfully causing self-inflicted injury.
(f) Committing other similar acts by other means.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Dishonest Conduct by Officials
metadata.text_en: If any civil servant or member of an organization acting under this Law is convicted of committing any act or omission with dishonest intent while performing their duties, they shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years, or with a fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Abetting Offenses
metadata.text_en: Whoever is convicted of abetting any offense under this Law shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year, or with a fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Burden of Proof in Non-Compliance Cases
metadata.text_en: In a case where an offense under section 23 is prosecuted, the burden of proving that there was a valid reason for the non-compliance shall lie with the defendant.

metadata.title_en: No Exemption from Service After Conviction
