metadata.text_en: A citizen shall not be exempt from People's Military Service under this Law, even if they have been criminally convicted for an offense under sections 23 and 24.

metadata.title_en: Formation of Organizations and Committees
metadata.text_en: The Union Government may form necessary organizations and committees and assign duties to effectively implement the provisions of this Law.

metadata.title_en: Offense Under Section 26 is Cognizable
metadata.text_en: The offense under section 26 of this Law shall be deemed a cognizable offense.

metadata.title_en: Immunity for Good Faith Actions
metadata.text_en: No act performed by any organization or member of an organization in good faith in accordance with the law, rules, and regulations shall be liable as a criminal offense or civil liability.

metadata.title_en: Issuance of Rules and Regulations
metadata.text_en: In implementing the provisions of this Law, the Ministry of Defence may issue necessary rules, procedures, notifications, orders, and directives.

metadata.title_en: Repeal of 1959 People's Military Service Act
metadata.text_en: The 1959 People's Military Service Act is hereby repealed by this Law.

metadata.title_en: Short Title
metadata.text_en: This Law shall be called the Telecommunications Law.

metadata.title_en: Scope of Application (Territorial)
metadata.text_en: The provisions of this Law shall apply to any person, department, or organization within the territorial boundaries of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar, including its land, water, and air.

metadata.title_en: Scope of Application (Extraterritorial)
metadata.text_en: The provisions of this Law shall also apply to Myanmar citizens residing in any place outside the Republic of the Union of Myanmar.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Telecommunication
metadata.text_en: 'Telecommunication' means the transmission or reception of any information by wire, optical fiber, or other electromagnetic wire, or by radio waves, light rays, electromagnetic radiation, or any other distant method, whether directly or indirectly.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Information
metadata.text_en: 'Information' means facts, text, images, sound, codes, signs, signals, and any collection of data, as well as things composed of more than one of these and similar matters.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Wireless Telecommunication
metadata.text_en: 'Wireless Telecommunication' means the transmission or reception of any information between a transmitting station and a receiving station using radio waves, light rays, electromagnetic radiation, or any other distant method, without using a wire, optical fiber, or other electromagnetic wire.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Telecommunication Network
metadata.text_en: 'Telecommunication Network' means a system where network access equipment, telecommunication equipment, computers, similar equipment, and systems and equipment that can be used in conjunction with them are interconnected and used, whether by wire or wirelessly, using a telecommunication technology.

metadata.title_en: Definition of User-side Network Boundary
metadata.text_en: 'User-side network boundary' means the place where telecommunication equipment is initially connected, or the place where information is received by a user, or the place of the network access equipment where information is sent to the user.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Telecommunication Service Business
metadata.text_en: 'Telecommunication Service Business' means carrying out one or more of the following businesses: network access support services, network services, and application services.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Network Access Support Service Business
metadata.text_en: 'Network Access Support Service Business' means holding a network access support equipment and leasing it to a telecommunication service business licensee, or providing services on that network access support equipment oneself.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Network Service Business
metadata.text_en: 'Network Service Business' means a business that provides services using a telecommunication method for the mutual transmission of information. This term does not include providing services solely for the user-side network boundary.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Application Service Business
metadata.text_en: 'Application Service Business' means any business that provides services by using one or more networks. This does not include providing services solely for the user-side network boundary.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Telecommunication Equipment
metadata.text_en: 'Telecommunication Equipment' means telecommunication equipment specifically designated by the Ministry for the purpose of this Law.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Telecommunication Market
metadata.text_en: 'Telecommunication Market' means a market related to a telecommunication service business, or a market related to products or services that are used in conjunction with such a service business.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Data Content
metadata.text_en: 'Data Content' means text, audio, still images, and moving images that can be created, modified, stored, retrieved, or transmitted electronically, or their re-presentation as video, combined presentation, or in any other combined form.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Network Access Equipment
metadata.text_en: 'Network Access Equipment' means a component of a physical infrastructure used in the operation of network services, or a combination of such components.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Spectrum
metadata.text_en: 'Spectrum' means the continuous spectrum of electromagnetic waves, including frequencies from 3 Hz to 420 THz.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Telecommunication Numbering Plan
metadata.text_en: 'Telecommunication Numbering Plan' means the national telecommunication numbering plan designated for use in telecommunication services for communication.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Electronic Addressing Plan
metadata.text_en: 'Electronic Addressing Plan' means a structured electronic addressing plan using letters, numbers, or a combination of letters and numbers for use in mutual communication between information systems.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Telecommunication Equipment License
metadata.text_en: 'Telecommunication Equipment License' means a telecommunication equipment license issued to a person, department, or organization for holding or using a type of telecommunication equipment.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Operating License
metadata.text_en: 'Operating License' means an operating license issued to a person, department, or organization under this Law to establish and operate a type of telecommunication service business.

metadata.title_en: Definition of License
metadata.text_en: 'License' means an operating license and a telecommunication equipment license issued to a person, department, or organization under this Law.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Ministry
metadata.text_en: 'Ministry' means the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology of the Union Government.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Directorate
metadata.text_en: 'Directorate' means the Directorate of Communications under the Ministry.

metadata.title_en: Definition of Appeals Court
metadata.text_en: 'Appeals Court' means the Telecommunications Appeals Tribunal formed by the Union Government to which appeals can be made if dissatisfied with an order or decision made by the Ministry.

metadata.title_en: Objectives of the Law (National Development)
metadata.text_en: To support the development and progress of the State through telecommunications technology.

metadata.title_en: Objectives of the Law (Competitive Telecommunication Services)
metadata.text_en: To promote the emergence of high-quality and affordable telecommunication service businesses that provide fair and transparent competition among domestic and international entities in the developing telecommunications sector.

metadata.title_en: Objectives of the Law (Network Expansion and Public Access)
metadata.text_en: To expand telecommunication networks nationwide and to increase opportunities for public access to telecommunication technology and information.

metadata.title_en: Objectives of the Law (Protection of Operators and Users)
metadata.text_en: To protect telecommunication service business operators and users in accordance with the law.

metadata.title_en: Objectives of the Law (Supervision for National Security)
metadata.text_en: To supervise telecommunication service businesses, network access equipment, and telecommunication equipment that can only be used with a license, for matters related to national peace and security and public safety.

metadata.title_en: Application for License
metadata.text_en: Domestic and foreign individuals, departments, and organizations wishing to establish and operate any of the following telecommunication service businesses shall apply to the Directorate in accordance with the permission and operating license requirements:

metadata.title_en: Network Access Support Service Business
metadata.text_en: Network access support service business,

metadata.title_en: Network Service Business
metadata.text_en: Network service business,

metadata.title_en: Application Service Business
metadata.text_en: Application service business.

metadata.title_en: Publication of Selection Policies
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall issue and announce to the public the policies, procedures, and rules related to the selection for operating telecommunication service businesses.

metadata.title_en: Submission of Application to Ministry
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall examine the application under Section 5 in accordance with Section 6 and submit it to the Ministry with its approval.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Approval for Domestic Applications
metadata.text_en: Upon reviewing the submission under Section 7, if it is a domestic application, the Ministry may permit the establishment and operation of a telecommunication service business by obtaining the approval of the Union Government as required for certain operations, or by its own decision for operations that do not require such approval.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Approval for Foreign Applications
metadata.text_en: Upon reviewing the submission under Section 7, if it is a foreign application, the Ministry may permit the establishment and operation of a telecommunication service business by obtaining the approval of the Union Government.

metadata.title_en: License Term and Issuance
metadata.text_en: When permitting the establishment and operation of a telecommunication service business under sub-sections (a) and (b) of this section, the Ministry shall instruct the Directorate to issue an operating license for a term of at least 5 years and at most 20 years per instance.

metadata.title_en: International Gateway Operations
metadata.text_en: If a telecommunication service business licensee applies for an international primary entry/exit point operation license for international telecommunication and interconnection, the Ministry may permit the operation in accordance with the rules and regulations specifically designated for that business, after obtaining the approval of the Union Government.

metadata.title_en: Extension of License Term
metadata.text_en: If the Directorate examines and submits an application for extension of the operating license term, the Ministry may permit the extension.

metadata.title_en: Issuance of Operating License by Directorate
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall issue operating licenses to domestic and foreign individuals, departments, and organizations permitted to establish and operate telecommunication service businesses in accordance with the Ministry's instructions under sub-section (c) of Section 8, by setting rules for the respective businesses.

metadata.title_en: Cooperation with Other Entities
metadata.text_en: A licensee may cooperate with domestic, foreign, individuals, departments, and organizations in accordance with the law.

metadata.title_en: Agreements with Other Licensees
metadata.text_en: A licensee may enter into an agreement with another licensee to carry out the following matters:

metadata.title_en: Interconnection and Intercommunication
metadata.text_en: Interconnection and intercommunication among telecommunication service businesses in accordance with the provisions of Chapter (10) of this Law.

metadata.title_en: Sharing Network Access Equipment
metadata.text_en: Sharing of network access equipment.

metadata.title_en: Other Specified Matters
metadata.text_en: Carrying out other matters specifically stated and designated in the operating license.

metadata.title_en: Application for License Renewal
metadata.text_en: If a licensee wishes to continue operations upon the expiry of the license term, they shall apply to the Directorate for an extension of the term in accordance with the regulations before the license term expires.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Approval for Renewal
metadata.text_en: The Directorate may examine the application and extend the operating license term with the approval of the Ministry.

metadata.title_en: License Requirement for Telecommunication Equipment
metadata.text_en: Local and foreign individuals, departments, and organizations shall apply to the Department for a telecommunication equipment license, in accordance with the terms and conditions of the license, if they wish to possess or use any telecommunication equipment designated by the Ministry, only after obtaining a telecommunication equipment license. However, a telecommunication equipment license is not required for the following:

metadata.title_en: Possession and Use of Telecommunication Equipment for Business Licensees
metadata.text_en: Possession and use of telecommunication equipment purchased for use by a business licensee.

metadata.title_en: Possession and Use of Telecommunication Equipment obtained from a Business Licensee
metadata.text_en: Possession and use of telecommunication equipment obtained from a business licensee.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Responsibilities
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall:

metadata.title_en: Review and Issue/Deny Licenses
metadata.text_en: Review the license application for the relevant telecommunication equipment under Section 13 and may issue or deny the license.

metadata.title_en: Stipulate Terms and License Period
metadata.text_en: When issuing a license, it shall simultaneously stipulate the terms and conditions and the license period.

metadata.title_en: Licensee's Responsibilities
metadata.text_en: A licensee shall:

metadata.title_en: Comply with Laws and Directives
metadata.text_en: Comply with this Law and the rules, procedures, notifications, orders, and directives issued under this Law.

metadata.title_en: Comply with License Terms
metadata.text_en: Comply with the terms and conditions contained in the license.

metadata.title_en: Payment of Fees
metadata.text_en: Pay fees, including those for licenses, license renewals, usage, services, and other technical or administrative fees, in accordance with the stipulated terms.

metadata.title_en: Comply with Operational Procedures and Directives
metadata.text_en: Comply with relevant operational procedures and standard operating procedures, as well as the directives of the Ministry and the Department.

metadata.title_en: Preventing Harm to the State
metadata.text_en: A licensee shall act to ensure that the State does not suffer any harm or loss due to consequences arising from breaching or failing to comply with the license conditions.

metadata.title_en: Responsibilities of a Business Licensee
metadata.text_en: A business licensee shall:

metadata.title_en: Comply with Approved Frequency Allocation
metadata.text_en: Comply with the frequency allocation plan approved under this Law.

metadata.title_en: Apply for Approval for New Services or Partnerships
metadata.text_en: If they wish to expand into a new telecommunication service business not yet licensed, or to engage in a joint venture or partnership with another business licensee, they shall re-apply for approval and a business license in accordance with the provisions of Chapter 3.

metadata.title_en: Comply with Directives Regarding Interference or Suspension
metadata.text_en: Comply when instructed to carry out necessary modifications or temporary suspension of a telecommunication service if a test or notification indicates it causes technical interference to another telecommunication service.

metadata.title_en: Confidentiality of Information by Business Licensees
metadata.text_en: A business licensee shall securely store information, data, and confidential information of individual users transmitted or received through their telecommunication service and shall not disclose it to unauthorized persons, except in cases permitted by existing laws.

metadata.title_en: Responsibilities of a Telecommunication Equipment Licensee
metadata.text_en: A telecommunication equipment licensee shall:

metadata.title_en: Use Equipment at Designated Location
metadata.text_en: Use their owned telecommunication equipment only at the location specified in the license.

metadata.title_en: Ensure National Security
metadata.text_en: Ensure that the use of telecommunication equipment permitted under the license does not harm the security of the State.

metadata.title_en: Comply with Directorate's Directives
metadata.text_en: Comply with the directives from the Directorate regarding the equipment they use.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Responsibilities for Spectrum and Satellite Orbital Slots
metadata.text_en: The Ministry shall manage, allocate, and supervise the nationwide frequency spectrum, as well as the satellite orbital slots allocated to the Republic of the Union of Myanmar in accordance with international telecommunication conventions.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Authority to Grant Frequency Usage Rights
metadata.text_en: The Directorate may grant usage rights for frequency bands in the nationwide frequency allocation plan to individuals, departments, and organizations by stipulating terms and conditions.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Directive on Numbering and Electronic Addresses
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall direct business licensees to comply with and use the telecommunication numbering allocation and electronic address allocation approved by the Ministry.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Authority to Grant Numbering and Electronic Address Usage
metadata.text_en: The Directorate may grant usage rights for telecommunication numbers and electronic addresses for use in a business licensee's telecommunication service by stipulating terms and conditions.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Oversight of Numbering and Electronic Address Usage
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall inspect and supervise the use of telecommunication numbers and electronic addresses by business licensees in accordance with the directives in Section 21.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Authority to Issue Technical Standards
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall, with the concurrence of the Ministry, determine and issue relevant technical standards for licenses according to the nature of the business.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Oversight of Technical Standards Compliance
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall oversee and regulate licensees to ensure compliance with technical standards.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Authority to Set Standards for Import/Export of Communication Equipment
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall determine the standards for network access equipment and types of telecommunication equipment for import into and export from the country.

metadata.title_en: Application for Technical Standard Compliance Approval
metadata.text_en: Anyone wishing to manufacture, sell, or distribute any type of network access equipment or telecommunication equipment shall apply to the Directorate for technical standard compliance approval, as stipulated.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Authority to Approve/Deny Technical Standard Compliance
metadata.text_en: The Directorate may review the application for technical standard compliance and may approve or deny it.

metadata.title_en: Submission of Service Rates by Business Licensee
metadata.text_en: A business licensee shall submit the proposed service rates to the Directorate, whether for existing services or new services to be provided, in connection with a telecommunication service business.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Approval of Service Rates
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall review the submitted service rates and approve them with the concurrence of the Ministry.

metadata.title_en: Responsibilities of a Business Licensee (Service Rates)
metadata.text_en: A business licensee shall:

metadata.title_en: Provide Services According to Approved Rates
metadata.text_en: Provide services in accordance with the service rates approved in Section 29, sub-section (b).

metadata.title_en: Seek Prior Approval for Rate Changes
metadata.text_en: If they wish to amend, change, or cancel the approved service rates, they shall do so only after obtaining prior approval from the Directorate.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Authority to Set Consumer Protection Standards
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall, with the concurrence of the Ministry, determine standards to protect consumers in connection with business licenses.

metadata.title_en: Business Licensee's Compliance with Consumer Protection Standards
metadata.text_en: A business licensee shall comply with the standards that protect consumers.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Authority to Set Interconnection Rules
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall determine the necessary rules for matters related to the interconnection and mutual communication of network access equipment with network services.

metadata.title_en: Interconnection Between Licensees
metadata.text_en: If a business licensee requests another licensed entity to allow interconnection and mutual communication of network services with network access equipment for any telecommunication service, it can be done with the mutual agreement of both parties and the approval of the Directorate.

metadata.title_en: Interconnection Standards for Licensees
metadata.text_en: When business licensees allow access and interconnection to their networks:

metadata.title_en: Ensure Fair and Non-Discriminatory Access
metadata.text_en: Ensure fairness and non-discrimination, and do not cause the quality of service within the network to fall below standard.

metadata.title_en: Accept Inspection of Quality Standards
metadata.text_en: If the Directorate inspects the quality standards as required, they shall accept the inspection.

metadata.title_en: Prohibition of Anti-Competitive Practices
metadata.text_en: A business licensee shall not engage in any activity that undermines the nature of free competition in the telecommunication market.

metadata.title_en: Prohibition of Anti-Competitive Agreements
metadata.text_en: A business licensee shall not engage in understanding, agreement, arrangements, or contracts with any individual, department, or organization regarding the following matters:

metadata.title_en: Unilateral Rate Setting
metadata.text_en: Acting to unilaterally set rates according to their own will.

metadata.title_en: Market Sharing to Reduce Competition
metadata.text_en: Acting with the intention of reducing competition and dividing the market.

metadata.title_en: Restricting Procurement from Suppliers
metadata.text_en: Acting to prevent procurement from any telecommunication equipment supplier or seller.

metadata.title_en: Unfair Opposition to Competitors
metadata.text_en: Unfairly opposing any of their competitors by illegal means.

metadata.title_en: Prohibition of User Restrictions by Licensees
metadata.text_en: A business licensee shall not impose restrictions on users for the use of telecommunication equipment or telecommunication services, whether obtained by themselves or by another person.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Power to Direct Cessation of Anti-Competitive Activities
metadata.text_en: If activities hindering competition in the telecommunication market, as prohibited in Sections 35, 36, and 37, occur, the Directorate may, with the approval of the Ministry, direct the business licensee to cease such activities.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's General Responsibilities
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall:

metadata.title_en: Implement and Oversee Law
metadata.text_en: Manage, supervise, and control the implementation of the provisions of this Law in accordance with the directives of the Ministry.

metadata.title_en: Inspect and Supervise Telecommunication Businesses
metadata.text_en: Inspect and supervise licensed telecommunication service businesses, network access equipment businesses, and telecommunication equipment businesses.

metadata.title_en: Form Inspection Teams
metadata.text_en: For inspection under sub-section (b), if necessary, it may form inspection teams with appropriate personnel and delegate duties.

metadata.title_en: Implementation of Law Provisions
metadata.text_en: In implementing the provisions of this Law:

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Powers for Implementation
metadata.text_en: The Directorate may:

metadata.title_en: Summon and Request Information
metadata.text_en: Summon and interrogate necessary individuals, and request the submission of necessary information, evidence, documents, and records.

metadata.title_en: Enter and Inspect Premises and Equipment
metadata.text_en: Enter and inspect buildings, premises, and equipment used for telecommunication service businesses.

metadata.title_en: Inspect and Copy Records
metadata.text_en: Inspect, copy, and take extracts from accounts, documents, and records related to telecommunication service businesses.

metadata.title_en: Stipulate Record Keeping Procedures
metadata.text_en: Stipulate procedures for business licensees to follow regarding the compilation and storage of business accounts and records.

metadata.title_en: Inspection Team's Powers
metadata.text_en: An inspection team formed under Section 39, sub-section (c) may exercise the powers under Section 40, sub-section (a), sub-paragraphs (1), (2), and (3) as authorized by the Directorate.

metadata.title_en: Business Licensee's Powers for Network Access Equipment
metadata.text_en: A business licensee may carry out the following activities on land and buildings for which they have obtained a two-party agreement with a stipulated period from the owner or manager of that land and building, to install or connect network access equipment:

metadata.title_en: Site Survey and Investigation
metadata.text_en: Enter the site, inspect, measure, record elevations, survey, dig, and conduct surface soil investigations, including other necessary matters, to select and determine a suitable business site.

metadata.title_en: Installation and Security of Network Access Equipment
metadata.text_en: Place, store, install, connect network access equipment, and take security measures for materials as necessary for network service-related operations, both above and below the ground, and above and below water.

metadata.title_en: Inspection, Maintenance, and Repair
metadata.text_en: Enter and inspect network access equipment, maintain, and repair it.

metadata.title_en: Agreement Continuation upon Change of Ownership
metadata.text_en: If there is a change in ownership of the land and building for which the business licensee has an agreement to carry out the activities in Section 41, the licensee shall obtain an agreement to continue installing or connecting network access equipment on that land and building.

metadata.title_en: Non-Interference with Public Infrastructure
metadata.text_en: When a business licensee installs, maintains, repairs, modifies, or removes network access equipment, they shall not cause any hindrance or obstruction to public roads, vehicular roads, railways, rivers, canals, other waterways, irrigation systems, water channels, water supply systems, telecommunication operations, port operations, or other public or private operations.

metadata.title_en: Prior Notification for Site Entry
metadata.text_en: A business licensee shall not enter any land without prior notice to the owner for preliminary surveys to install or remove network access equipment.

metadata.title_en: Damage Prevention Measures
metadata.text_en: A business licensee shall take necessary precautions to minimize damage when installing or maintaining network access equipment.

metadata.title_en: Compensation for Damages
metadata.text_en: If a business licensee causes injury or death to any person, or damage or loss to any property, due to negligence or deliberate failure when installing or maintaining their network access equipment, the injured or damaged person has the right to claim compensation from the business licensee in accordance with the stipulated terms.

metadata.title_en: Safety and Legal Compliance in Infrastructure Work
metadata.text_en: A licensee under this Law shall carry out any work that may affect highways, roads, streets, rivers, drains, other waterways, irrigation systems, canals, water supply systems, telecommunication operations, port operations, or other public or private operations, and when laying network access equipment above or below ground for telecommunication service businesses, shall act in accordance with the law, with due regard for the safety of life and property.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Authority Regarding Network Installation in Buildings/Land
metadata.text_en: If the Directorate deems it necessary for a telecommunication service or network in a building under construction or a completed building and land plot, or if it deems it necessary to improve the quality of network services within the building and land plot, it may:

metadata.title_en: Coordinate for Space Provision
metadata.text_en: Coordinate with relevant organizations to provide space for the installation of network access equipment within or on the building, or on the land plot, by the nearest service provider or the owner of the building and land, within the stipulated time.

metadata.title_en: Direct Installation of Network Access Equipment
metadata.text_en: Direct the business licensee to install the network access equipment within the stipulated time.

metadata.title_en: Direct Cost Bearing for Installation
metadata.text_en: Direct the business licensee to bear all or part of the costs incurred in supplementing network access equipment.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Role in Minimizing Costs and Environmental Impact
metadata.text_en: The Directorate may manage and organize collaborative efforts to minimize unnecessary financial expenditure and to protect the natural environment during the construction and installation of network access equipment by business licensees.

metadata.title_en: Dispute Resolution for Licensees
metadata.text_en: (a) If a dispute arises between business licensees while carrying out telecommunication services or supplementing network access equipment, and they cannot resolve the dispute among themselves through negotiation, they may submit the dispute to the Directorate. (b) If a dispute arises while carrying out network services by connecting and using network access equipment and communicating with each other, they may submit the dispute to the Directorate.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Mediation and Decision in Disputes
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall mediate and decide on disputes between business licensees concerning the submission under section 50, or if no such submission is made, but the dispute may harm the public interest.

metadata.title_en: Appeals against Directorate's Decision
metadata.text_en: A person dissatisfied with the Directorate's mediation and decision under section 51 may: (1) If it is a matter related to telecommunication technology, appeal to the Ministry within 30 days from the date of the decision. (2) If it is not a matter related to telecommunication technology, claim their rights and interests for their damages in the relevant court under existing laws.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Actions on Appeal
metadata.text_en: Regarding the appeal under section 52(a), sub-section (1), the Ministry shall: (1) Conduct necessary inquiries. (2) Affirm, amend, or revoke the Directorate's decision.

metadata.title_en: Appeal to Arbitration Tribunal
metadata.text_en: A person dissatisfied with the Ministry's decision may appeal to the Arbitration Tribunal within 45 days from the date of the decision, in accordance with the procedures.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Directives for Telecommunication Development
metadata.text_en: To ensure widespread use of telecommunication services throughout the Republic of the Union of Myanmar, the Ministry may direct the Directorate to implement plans for expanding and constructing telecommunication infrastructure in underserved areas where telecommunication development is still low, and for improving and expanding telecommunication services.

metadata.title_en: Universal Service Fund Establishment and Oversight
metadata.text_en: For the public interest, the Ministry shall establish a Universal Service Obligation Fund to implement programs for fulfilling the universal telecommunication needs and shall oversee the fund.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Oversight of Universal Service Programs
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall use the fund established under section 54 and oversee the implementation of programs to fulfill universal telecommunication needs for the public interest.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Responsibilities for Universal Service
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall, with the approval of the Ministry, carry out the following programs under section 55: (a) Designating underserved areas where telecommunication development is still low. (b) Setting a universal target for fulfilling universal telecommunication needs for the public interest. (c) Defining universal service obligations that licensees must comply with to fulfill universal telecommunication needs for the public interest.

metadata.title_en: Administrative Orders for Licensee Violations
metadata.text_en: If a licensee violates any license condition, any duty in Schedule (5), any directive under section 38, the Directorate's mediation and decision under section 51, or the Ministry's decision under section 52(b), the Directorate may issue any of the following administrative orders: (a) Warning, (b) Suspending the license for a limited period, (c) Revoking the license.

metadata.title_en: Appeal against Directorate's Administrative Order
metadata.text_en: A person dissatisfied with any administrative order issued by the Directorate under section 57 may appeal to the Ministry within 30 days from the date of issuance of such order.

metadata.title_en: Appeal against Directorate's Administrative Order
metadata.text_en: A person dissatisfied with any administrative order issued by the Directorate under section 57 may appeal to the Ministry within 30 days from the date of issuance of such order.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Actions on Appeal against Administrative Order
metadata.text_en: Regarding the appeal under section 58(a), the Ministry shall:

metadata.title_en: Conduct Necessary Inquiries (If Required)
metadata.text_en: Conduct necessary inquiries, if required.

metadata.title_en: Affirm, Amend, or Revoke Directorate's Order
metadata.text_en: Affirm, amend, or revoke the Directorate's order.

metadata.title_en: Formation of Arbitration Tribunal by Union Government
metadata.text_en: The Union Government shall:

metadata.title_en: Constituting Arbitration Tribunal for Further Appeal
metadata.text_en: Constitute and assign an Arbitration Tribunal to allow further appeal when an aggrieved person submits an appeal regarding administrative decisions made by the Ministry under this Law concerning disputes.

metadata.title_en: Composition of Arbitration Tribunal
metadata.text_en: Constitute and assign the Arbitration Tribunal with a Chairman and not more than nine members.

metadata.title_en: Qualifications of Arbitration Tribunal Chairman and Members
metadata.text_en: The Chairman and members of the Arbitration Tribunal shall possess the following qualifications:

metadata.title_en: Qualifications of Arbitration Tribunal Chairman
metadata.text_en: The Chairman shall be a person who has served as a Region or State Chief Justice for at least five years or has held a position not lower than a Region or State level judicial officer or law officer for at least 10 years.

metadata.title_en: Qualifications of Arbitration Tribunal Members
metadata.text_en: The Arbitration Tribunal members shall be knowledgeable experts with a good reputation in telecommunication technology, law, and economics.

metadata.title_en: Arbitration Tribunal Hearing Procedures
metadata.text_en: The Arbitration Tribunal shall:

metadata.title_en: Advance Notice of Hearing Date
metadata.text_en: Announce the hearing date in advance and conduct the hearing on the specified date.

metadata.title_en: Hearing Applications of Concerned Parties
metadata.text_en: Hear the applications of the concerned parties regarding the submission.

metadata.title_en: Expedited Final Decision
metadata.text_en: Arrange to make a final decision expeditiously.

metadata.title_en: Final Decision by Majority Consent
metadata.text_en: The final decision of the Arbitration Tribunal shall be made with the consent of more than half of the members, including the Chairman.

metadata.title_en: Finality of Arbitration Tribunal's Decision
metadata.text_en: The decision of the Arbitration Tribunal shall be final.

metadata.title_en: Remuneration of Arbitration Tribunal Chairman and Members
metadata.text_en: The Chairman and members of the Arbitration Tribunal shall be entitled to receive salaries and allowances determined by the Union Government.

metadata.title_en: Term of Arbitration Tribunal
metadata.text_en: The term of the Arbitration Tribunal shall be the period from the date of its establishment until the final decision report is submitted to the Union Government.

metadata.title_en: Penalty for Operating Telecommunication Services Without License
metadata.text_en: Whoever is found guilty of operating telecommunication services without a business license shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years, and may also be liable to a fine.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Illegal Acts Related to Telecommunication Networks
metadata.text_en: Whoever is found guilty of committing any of the following acts shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years, or with a fine, or with both:

metadata.title_en: Unauthorized Interference with Telecommunication Networks
metadata.text_en: Unauthorized access or interference with a telecommunication network, or changing or destroying its standards, specifications, or basic conditions.

metadata.title_en: Introducing Malicious Software into Telecommunication Networks
metadata.text_en: Introducing a virus or any other illegal means into a telecommunication network with intent to damage it.

metadata.title_en: Financial Crimes Using Telecommunication Networks
metadata.text_en: Using a telecommunication network to acquire money or property, deceive, embezzle, or cause damage.

metadata.title_en: Harassment and Threats Using Telecommunication Networks
metadata.text_en: Using a telecommunication network to extort, abuse, illegally pressure, defame, interfere with, improperly influence, or threaten any person.

metadata.title_en: Penalty for Unauthorized Possession or Use of Licensed Telecommunication Equipment
metadata.text_en: Whoever is found guilty of possessing or using any telecommunication equipment designated for use only with a license, without obtaining a license, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year, or with a fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalties for Misconduct Related to Telecommunication
metadata.text_en: Whoever is found guilty of committing any of the following acts shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year, or with a fine, or with both:

metadata.title_en: Transmitting False Information
metadata.text_en: Communicating, receiving, broadcasting, distributing, or disseminating false information with dishonest intent or participating in such acts.

metadata.title_en: Unauthorized Interference with Information Transmission
metadata.text_en: Impeding, obstructing, or interfering with the transmission, reception, communication, distribution, or dissemination of information without authorization.

metadata.title_en: Unauthorized Entry into Licensed Operational Areas
metadata.text_en: Entering any operational area of a telecommunication service designated by the Directorate with consent, without authorization.

metadata.title_en: Obstructing Duty Performance
metadata.text_en: Impeding, obstructing, or interfering with the performance of duties by any person assigned duties by a business licensee in a telecommunication service.

metadata.title_en: Penalty for Unauthorized Disclosure of Confidential Information
metadata.text_en: Whoever is found guilty of disclosing confidential information obtained through a trustworthy or confidential system related to telecommunication, to another person who is not concerned with it, except for court cases and court orders, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year, or with a fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalty for Using/Possessing Non-Compliant Equipment
metadata.text_en: Whoever, being a licensee, is found guilty of using, possessing, supplying, or importing into the country any network access equipment or telecommunication equipment that does not comply with the prescribed technical standards, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year, or with a fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalty for Obstructing Duty Performance of Directorate or Inspection Team
metadata.text_en: Whoever obstructs, impedes, or interferes with the performance of duties by the Directorate or an inspection team formed by the Directorate, or by a public servant under this Law, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months, or with a fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalty for Violating Rules, Regulations, Orders, or Directives
metadata.text_en: Whoever is found guilty of violating any prohibition in the rules, regulations, bylaws, orders, notifications, directives, and procedures issued under this Law, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months, or with a fine, or with both.

metadata.title_en: Penalty for Attempting, Conspiring, or Abetting Offenses
metadata.text_en: Whoever attempts to commit any offense under this Law, or conspires to commit such offense, or abets the commission of such offense, shall be punished with the penalty provided for that offense in this Law.

metadata.title_en: Formation of National Telecommunication Advisory Committee
metadata.text_en: For the purpose of advising on matters related to telecommunication in the Republic of the Union of Myanmar, such as technical standards, spectrum management, consumer protection, and strategic plans for the development of the telecommunication sector, the Ministry shall, with the approval of the Government, issue a notification and constitute a National Telecommunication Advisory Committee, with a Minister or a person assigned by the Minister as Chairman, and representatives from information and telecommunication businesses, consumers, experts, and the Directorate as members. The duties of the Committee shall be separately prescribed.

metadata.title_en: Government Directives for National Security and Rule of Law
metadata.text_en: To safeguard national security and rule of law, and to prevent harm to citizens' fundamental rights, the Union Government may direct concerned organizations as necessary regarding any information and communications.

metadata.title_en: Inspection and Oversight of Telecommunication Services
metadata.text_en: The Ministry or a department or organization assigned by it may, for national defense and security matters, or for the public interest, enter, inspect, supervise, and request submission of records and documents, if necessary, within any telecommunication service operation conducted by a business licensee.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Directives for Public Interest in Emergency Situations
metadata.text_en: When a situation arises that requires action for the public interest, the Ministry may, with the consent of the Government, instruct a business licensee to temporarily suspend telecommunication services, to not perform certain types of communication, to block or restrict communications, to enable access to necessary information and communications, and to temporarily requisition and use telecommunication services and equipment.

metadata.title_en: Licensee's Preparedness for Security Matters
metadata.text_en: The licensee shall make advance arrangements to ensure that any telecommunication service under section 77 can be carried out in accordance with the law for security matters.

metadata.title_en: Submission of Evidence when Physical Presentation is Difficult
metadata.text_en: If any evidence related to an offense prosecuted under this Law is difficult to present before the court, a report stating how the evidence is preserved or other relevant documents and records may be presented. The relevant court may treat such presentation as if the evidence was presented before the court and handle the matter in accordance with the law.

metadata.title_en: Designation of Offenses as Cognizable
metadata.text_en: The offenses under this Law are designated as cognizable offenses.

metadata.title_en: Prior Approval from Ministry for Prosecution
metadata.text_en: In prosecuting any offense under this Law, prior approval from the Ministry shall be obtained.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Determination of Fees and Charges
metadata.text_en: The Ministry shall determine the fees and charges for licenses, license renewals, spectrum usage, telecommunication number assignments, and electronic address assignments.

metadata.title_en: Exemptions for Public Interest Matters
metadata.text_en: For the public interest, the Ministry may, with the approval of the Union Government, grant exemption from obtaining necessary approvals, licenses, and receipts, or from paying fees under this Law, to any government department, organization, or individual. However, for matters related to national emergency, national defense and security, and natural disasters, action can be taken without obtaining prior approval from the Union Government. Such actions shall be reported back to the Union Government.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's Formulation of Regulations, Procedures, and Standards
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall, with the approval of the Ministry, formulate regulations, operational procedures, and necessary standards concerning telecommunication services.

metadata.title_en: Directorate's International and Technical Engagements
metadata.text_en: The Directorate shall:

metadata.title_en: Coordination with International and Regional Organizations
metadata.text_en: In implementing the provisions of international telecommunication conventions ratified by the State, the Directorate may communicate and coordinate with international telecommunication organizations and regional organizations concerning telecommunication services in accordance with the Ministry's directives.

metadata.title_en: Organizing Technical Examinations and Issuing Certificates
metadata.text_en: Organize and conduct telecommunication technology and expertise examinations in accordance with the provisions of international telecommunication conventions and issue certificates.

metadata.title_en: Transitional Provisions for Previous Acts
metadata.text_en: Under The Myanmar Telegraph Act, 1885 and The Myanmar Wireless Telegraphy Act, 1934:

metadata.title_en: Recognition of Existing Licenses
metadata.text_en: Any license issued and not yet expired shall be deemed a license issued under this Law and shall remain valid until its expiration date. If continued operation is desired after the expiration of such license, an application for a license shall be made in accordance with this Law before its expiration.

metadata.title_en: Continued Application of Previous Rules and Orders
metadata.text_en: The rules, orders, notifications, and directives previously issued shall remain in force as long as they are not inconsistent with this Law.

metadata.title_en: Formation of Myanmar Telecommunications Commission
metadata.text_en: The Union Government shall, within two years from the date this Law comes into force, constitute a suitable Union-level independent Myanmar Telecommunications Commission, headed by an individual, to carry out the duties under this Law concerning telecommunication services.

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Power to Clarify Technical Terms
metadata.text_en: If it becomes necessary to clarify the meaning of any technical term related to telecommunication in this Law, the Ministry may issue a notification to clarify it.

metadata.title_en: Implementation of Law's Provisions
metadata.text_en: In implementing the provisions of this Law:

metadata.title_en: Ministry's Power to Issue Rules and Regulations
metadata.text_en: The Ministry may, with the consent of the Union Government, issue necessary rules, regulations, and bylaws.

metadata.title_en: Ministry and Directorate's Power to Issue Orders and Directives
metadata.text_en: The Ministry may also issue necessary orders, notifications, directives, and procedures, and the Directorate may also issue necessary orders and directives.

metadata.title_en: Repeal of Previous Acts
metadata.text_en: The following Acts are hereby repealed by this Law:

metadata.title_en: The Myanmar Telegraph Act, 1885
metadata.text_en: The Myanmar Telegraph Act, 1885.

metadata.title_en: The Myanmar Wireless Telegraphy Act, 1934
metadata.text_en: The Myanmar Wireless Telegraphy Act, 1934.
